title: Business Analyst, Geneve
company_name: UNHCR (United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees)
description:
Only candidates who are not nationals of the country of assignment are eligible to apply to this position

Hardship LevelH (no hardship)

Family TypeFamily

Residential location (if applicable)

GradePR3

Staff Member / Affiliate TypeProfessional
• S taff members will not normally serve in International Professional positions in the country of their nationality. In addition, in case of a first appointment upon recruitment, the assignment must be outside the staff member’s country of nationality.
In practical terms this means that you are not eligible to apply for International Professional vacancies advertised in the country where you are national of.

ReasonRegular > Regular Assignment

Remote work acceptedNo

Target Start Date2023-05-25

Job Posting End DateJune 15, 2023

Standard Job DescriptionBusiness Analyst Organizational Setting and Work Relationships The Business Analyst is a leading professional who is expected to deliver new insight and lasting business value by leveraging... the many systems, analytics and business opportunities offered by cutting edge technology. The incumbent contributes to end-to-end integration and proactively manages updates from a business transformation leadership perspective, utilizing skills and knowledge of the relevant area. The incumbent leads client-facing design sessions and related change management for the on-going renovation of work practices, their streamlining and simplification; to do so, liaises with all relevant stakeholders to document procedures, brings awareness of procedure changes, and supports process reconfiguration to help transform the Organization from a largely transactional model to a strategic business partner for field operations and senior management. S/he will be working closely with all relevant stakeholders to enhance the use of state of the art technology within the Area of Responsibility (AoR). All UNHCR staff members are accountable to perform their duties as reflected in their job description. They do so within their delegated authorities, in line with the regulatory framework of UNHCR which includes the UN Charter, UN Staff Regulations and Rules, UNHCR Policies and Administrative Instructions as well as relevant accountability frameworks. In addition, staff members are required to discharge their responsibilities in a manner consistent with the core, functional, cross-functional and managerial competencies and UNHCR¿s core values of professionalism, integrity and respect for diversity. Duties - Recommend functional and technical solutions for new or amended technologic services, procedures or systems to meet the defined business use cases. - Ensure end-to-end integration of business processes across systems within the AoR. - Ensure continuous systems¿ support through UNHCR¿s governance model, including managed service providers. - Undertake quality assurance of delivered work from a functional perspective (Functional testing, Integration testing, Business Process testing and User Acceptance Testing), managing Sandbox and Production environments in accordance with UNHCR¿s governance model. - Build strong business relationship with all stakeholders with respect to applications within the AoR. - Conduct business analysis and make recommendations on how systems and analytics can be used to improve its value as a strategic partner for field operations and senior management. - Conduct quality funding analysis in a structured manner for expedited and more comprehensive outputs. - Identify and analyse funding gaps and surpluses in a systematic way so that necessary resource allocation decisions can be made by the senior management on time. - Coordinate business analysis and implementation of configuration proposals for systems within the AoR that minimize complexity, simplify processes and streamlines management procedures. - Advise on complex system design issues, including how system configuration and use of analytics can help achieve targets and key performance indicators and benchmarks, etc. - Contribute to enhanced analytics (AI, Machine Learning, etc.), reports to UNHCR senior management, e.g. on key business driver insights and performance indicators. - Coordinate change management for work practice renovation initiatives supported by the systems within the AoR. - Recommend and analyse benchmarks within the AoR with those of comparable humanitarian organizations. - Interface with the relevant counterparts and business process owners to prepare and test regular updates to the system within the AoR, including monitoring that all licensed capabilities are fully applied at all times. - Build capacity for relevant business process owners to be aware of and prepared to use new or updated system capabilities. - Build capacity, in liaison with GLDC, for relevant business process owners to develop and publish timely end-user training materials, e.g. short videos, for all future system updates and business innovation initiatives within the AoR. - Undertake and lead relevant system testing, coordinate and liaise with all levels of system support. - Prepare and develop user-friendly and cost-efficient technologic tools and business requirements within the AoR; document business requirements and later update related operating procedures and/or training materials. - Manage and provide advice on basic security features, system roles and responsibilities as well as audit reports. - Conduct report writing and report maintenance, set up actionable dashboards to meet the requirements of (regional) partners and their clients. - Negotiate business requirements with stakeholders. - Perform other related duties as required. Minimum Qualifications Education & Professional Work Experience Years of Experience / Degree Level For P3/NOC - 6 years relevant experience with Undergraduate degree; or 5 years relevant experience with Graduate degree; or 4 years relevant experience with Doctorate degree Field(s) of Education International Relations; Information Technology; Business Administration; Economics; Social Science; or other relevant field. (Field(s) of Education marked with an asterisk* are essential) Certificates and/or Licenses Business Analysis; (Certificates and Licenses marked with an asterisk* are essential) Relevant Job Experience Essential Minimum 4 years of relevant experience at the professional level as a business analyst or project manager in international organizations, public or private sectors, of which at least 3 years should be in an international capacity directly relevant to the functions of this position. Documented relevant work experiences as a business/system analyst. Involvement in systems integration, implementation and related management and organizational change management initiatives in an international or multinational environment, with specific ERP or similar complex system management experience in at least one recent deployment project, preferably within the UN system or international public organization. Good knowledge of procedures/processes and exposure to provision of support services in an International Organization, preferably specific to configuration and maintenance in a UN or international public organization. Involvement in the analysis, design development and testing of system configurations. Excellent communication, interpersonal and negotiating skills and the capacity to communicate complex technical issues in layman's terms. Very good working knowledge of standard desktop tools such as MS Office suite and proven capability to learn new software tools. Good knowledge of the UN rules/procedures and processes. Experience in learning/training activities. Desirable Extensive knowledge of ERP systems or other complex business applications, including formal training or certification. Experience in business processes analysis and streamlining in the UN using CM applications. Functional Skills CL-Programme/Project Mgmt (formulation, implementation, programme cycles and reporting) DM-Data Collection and Analysis IT-IT Robotic Process Automation (RPA) MG-Business Process Innovation MG-Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) MG-Change Management MG-Project Management (Functional Skills marked with an asterisk* are essential) Language Requirements For International Professional and Field Service jobs: Knowledge of English and UN working language of the duty station if not English. For National Professional jobs: Knowledge of English and UN working language of the duty station if not English and local language. For General Service jobs: Knowledge of English and/or UN working language of the duty station if not English. All UNHCR workforce members must individually and collectively, contribute towards a working environment where each person feels safe, and empowered to perform their duties. This includes by demonstrating no tolerance for sexual exploitation and abuse, harassment including sexual harassment, sexism, gender inequality, discrimination and abuse of power. As individuals and as managers, all must be proactive in preventing and responding to inappropriate conduct, support ongoing dialogue on these matters and speaking up and seeking guidance and support from relevant UNHCR resources when these issues arise. This is a Standard Job Description for all UNHCR jobs with this job title and grade level. The Operational Context may contain additional essential and/or desirable qualifications relating to the specific operation and/or position. Any such requirements are incorporated by reference in this Job Description and will be considered for the screening, shortlisting and selection of candidates.

Desired Candidate Profile 1. Skills

Qualitative and quantitative analysis, analytical thinking
Communication and coordination skills
Experience with systems administration
Proficient in use of UNHCR systems (e.g. Compass, MSRP)
Strong understanding of Results-Based Management and programme management, UNHCR operation Management Cycle and key business processes in the plan-get-show phases
Proven working experience in planning/budgeting/monitoring/reporting/assurance business processes; or business process consulting; or in business transformation projects; or some combination of the three
Recent deployment project experience, preferably within the UN system or international public organizations
Data management and analysis

2. Behaviour:
Team player who engages, communicates and collaborates with varoius end users from different regions and at different levels.
Collaborative and open to innovation
Responsive, quick delivery of results
Connects the dots: understands the links between data and programme/operational implications; ability to idenitfy trends

3. Talents
Consistent and coherent
Inter-personal skills
Persistently looking for solutions
Deals well with complex environments and multiple stakeholders; can demonstrate ability to plan out project tasks or milestones, schedule workload and organize deadlines according to urgency.

4. Core values
UNHCR core values
Open-minded, looking for new solutions
Ethical
Discreet, able to handle confidential, sensitive information

Required languages (expected Overall ability is at least B2 level):

,

,

Desired languages

,

,

Operational context
Occupational Safety and Health Considerations:
Nature of Position:

DSPR guides strategic planning and multi-year planning; ensures that planning and resource allocation processes are simplified, evidence-based, and coherent; strengthens results-based management and reporting on impact and outcomes and resources allocated; strengthens management and oversight of projects implemented directly or by partners. DSPR has three services: Strategic and Programme Planning (SPPS); Annual Review and Budget Analysis (ARBAS); Implementation Management and Assurance (IMAS).

IMAS guides and supports implementation and programmatic management of UNHCR’s activities and outputs in country operations, implemented directly or with partners. Service ensures that systems, structures, policies, procedures, and teams are in place for effective implementation and operational delivery.

IMAS has two Units: Operational and Partnership Management, and Quality Assurance and Systems Coordination, responsible for ensuring tools and technologies for partner and project management are simple and effective. IMAS is responsible for matters related to the Framework for Implementing with Partners organisation wide, including setting policies, designing procedures, implementing strategies, coordination, implementation of strategies and regulations, and oversight.

QASCU focuses on supporting systems, processes, and capacities for all aspects of programme implementation, including planning, budgeting, monitoring and reporting. QASCU’s responsibilities include “business as usual” user support to comply with business milestones; identification and prioritization of potential enhancements; and liaison/coordination between DIST and various business units for testing and troubleshooting. Among the systems within QASCU’s portfolio are the Results-Based Management System (COMPASS) and the forthcoming Project Reporting, Oversight and Monitoring Solution (PROMS).

QASCU is responsible for a range of activities that include day-to-day management of the systems and solutions used by UNHCR and partners to plan, implement, report on, and manage risk of programmatic interventions. This involves understanding, investigating and resolving user queries and incidents; escalating technical issues to respective teams and working with them towards resolution; testing issue resolutions; analysing linkages between various systems; and providing business intelligence support. The Business Analyst will participate in all of these activities. To be fully productive, the Business Analyst should be knowledgeable in the related business processes and will play a key role in supporting the systems, coordinate with UNHCR counterparts in all phases of the system support, operational milestones, system improvement initiatives, change management and communication.

Supervised by senior staff member, the Business Analyst (Systems) will ensure that UNHCR policy and procedures in the results-based management areas of “plan,” “get” and “show” are supported by corporate systems, allowing Programme staff, Project Control/Assurance functions, multi-functional teams and results managers to do their part. The incumbent will support the identification, development and testing of enhancements and fixes, including integrations between the various systems that are part of the Business Transformation Project as they relate to DSPR’s portfolio.

S/he is expected to have solid experience in programming and operational delivery in the humanitarian/developmental sector. S/he is expected to have good analytical skills and experience in process review and (re)engineering. S/he must have good coordination and communications skills.
Living and Working Conditions:

Additional Qualifications

Skills

EducationBachelor of Arts (BA): Business Administration (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): Economics (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): Information Technology (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): International Relations (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): Social Science (Required)

CertificationsCertified Business Analysis Professional - Other

Work Experience

CompetenciesAccountability, Analytical thinking, Client & results orientation, Commitment to continuous learning, Communication, Empowering & building trust, Innovation & creativity, Judgement & decision making, Managing resource, Organizational awareness, Teamwork & collaboration, Technological awareness

UNHCR Salary Calculator

Compendium Add. 2 to March 2023 Compendium - Part B

Additional Information

Functional clearanceThis position doesn't require a functional clearance

Proficient in use of UNHCR systems (e.g. Compass, MSRP)
Strong understanding of Results-Based Management and programme management, UNHCR operation Management Cycle and key business processes in the plan-get-show phases
Proven working experience in planning/budgeting/monitoring/reporting/assurance business processes; or business process consulting; or in business transformation projects; or some combination of the three
Recent deployment project experience, preferably within the UN system or international public organizations
Data management and analysis

2. Behaviour:
Team player who engages, communicates and collaborates with varoius end users from different regions and at different levels.
Collaborative and open to innovation
Responsive, quick delivery of results
Connects the dots: understands the links between data and programme/operational implications; ability to idenitfy trends

3. Talents
Consistent and coherent
Inter-personal skills
Persistently looking for solutions
Deals well with complex environments and multiple stakeholders; can demonstrate ability to plan out project tasks or milestones, schedule workload and organize deadlines according to urgency.

4. Core values
UNHCR core values
Open-minded, looking for new solutions
Ethical
Discreet, able to handle confidential, sensitive information

Required languages (expected Overall ability is at least B2 level):

,

,

Desired languages

,

,

Operational context
Occupational Safety and Health Considerations:
Nature of Position:

DSPR guides strategic planning and multi-year planning; ensures that planning and resource allocation processes are simplified, evidence-based, and coherent; strengthens results-based management and reporting on impact and outcomes and resources allocated; strengthens management and oversight of projects implemented directly or by partners. DSPR has three services: Strategic and Programme Planning (SPPS); Annual Review and Budget Analysis (ARBAS); Implementation Management and Assurance (IMAS).

IMAS guides and supports implementation and programmatic management of UNHCR’s activities and outputs in country operations, implemented directly or with partners. Service ensures that systems, structures, policies, procedures, and teams are in place for effective implementation and operational delivery.

IMAS has two Units: Operational and Partnership Management, and Quality Assurance and Systems Coordination, responsible for ensuring tools and technologies for partner and project management are simple and effective. IMAS is responsible for matters related to the Framework for Implementing with Partners organisation wide, including setting policies, designing procedures, implementing strategies, coordination, implementation of strategies and regulations, and oversight.

QASCU focuses on supporting systems, processes, and capacities for all aspects of programme implementation, including planning, budgeting, monitoring and reporting. QASCU’s responsibilities include “business as usual” user support to comply with business milestones; identification and prioritization of potential enhancements; and liaison/coordination between DIST and various business units for testing and troubleshooting. Among the systems within QASCU’s portfolio are the Results-Based Management System (COMPASS) and the forthcoming Project Reporting, Oversight and Monitoring Solution (PROMS).

QASCU is responsible for a range of activities that include day-to-day management of the systems and solutions used by UNHCR and partners to plan, implement, report on, and manage risk of programmatic interventions. This involves understanding, investigating and resolving user queries and incidents; escalating technical issues to respective teams and working with them towards resolution; testing issue resolutions; analysing linkages between various systems; and providing business intelligence support. The Business Analyst will participate in all of these activities. To be fully productive, the Business Analyst should be knowledgeable in the related business processes and will play a key role in supporting the systems, coordinate with UNHCR counterparts in all phases of the system support, operational milestones, system improvement initiatives, change management and communication.

Supervised by senior staff member, the Business Analyst (Systems) will ensure that UNHCR policy and procedures in the results-based management areas of “plan,” “get” and “show” are supported by corporate systems, allowing Programme staff, Project Control/Assurance functions, multi-functional teams and results managers to do their part. The incumbent will support the identification, development and testing of enhancements and fixes, including integrations between the various systems that are part of the Business Transformation Project as they relate to DSPR’s portfolio.

S/he is expected to have solid experience in programming and operational delivery in the humanitarian/developmental sector. S/he is expected to have good analytical skills and experience in process review and (re)engineering. S/he must have good coordination and communications skills.
Living and Working Conditions:

Additional Qualifications

Skills

EducationBachelor of Arts (BA): Business Administration (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): Economics (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): Information Technology (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): International Relations (Required), Bachelor of Arts (BA): Social Science (Required)

CertificationsCertified Business Analysis Professional - Other

Work Experience

CompetenciesAccountability, Analytical thinking, Client & results orientation, Commitment to continuous learning, Communication, Empowering & building trust, Innovation & creativity, Judgement & decision making, Managing resource, Organizational awareness, Teamwork & collaboration, Technological awareness

UNHCR Salary Calculator

Compendium Add. 2 to March 2023 Compendium - Part B

Additional Information

Functional clearanceThis position doesn't require a functional clearance"]}]

title: Data Engineer
description:
Join Our Team as an IT Data Engineer in Geneva!

Company Overview: Elevate your career with an international banking group renowned for delivering highly customized investment, private banking, and asset management services to a diverse clientele of private and institutional investors, companies, and finance professionals.

Position: IT Data Engineer

About Us: At the forefront of digital transformation and cloud migration, our Data Hub, Reporting & MIS team is seeking skilled individuals to drive our ambitious initiatives forward.

Key Mission: Embark on a pivotal role in shaping our digital strategy by spearheading the establishment of our Data Hub on Azure. Join forces with our dynamic team to centralize data from our primary ecosystem tools, ensuring seamless accessibility for internal and regulatory reporting purposes.

Primary Responsibilities:

Collaborate closely with IT Application owners and Business Analysts to precisely articulate and delineate Data Hub... requirements.

Engage actively with our Data Architect to craft functional and technical solutions aligned with strategic objectives.

Contribute to the ongoing enhancement of our Data Hub and associated data delivery applications.

Analyze and rectify anomalies while meticulously documenting all interventions.

Adhere to established instructions and standards, conducting and executing unit tests with precision.

Operate both independently and collaboratively within project frameworks.

Deliver comprehensive training sessions to empower Application support team members.

Candidate Profile:

Demonstrable experience as a Data Engineer or Developer.

Bachelor's degree in computer engineering or related field.

Proficiency in pySpark is indispensable.

Familiarity with SQL, T-SQL, or PL/SQL is advantageous.

Exposure to Azure Synapse, Azure Logic Apps, or Power BI is desirable.

Fluent in French with a proficient command of English.

A proactive problem-solver and team player with exceptional adaptability.

Why Join Us:

Opportunity to contribute to cutting-edge digital initiatives in a globally recognized banking group.

Collaborative work environment fostering professional growth and development.

Competitive compensation package with additional benefits.

Join us in shaping the future of banking technology. Apply now

title: DATA ENGINEER
description:
Expleo offers a unique range of integrated engineering, quality and strategic consulting services for digital transformation. At a time of unprecedented technological acceleration, we are the trusted partner of innovative companies. We help them develop a competitive advantage and improve the daily lives of millions of people.

Joining Expleo Switzerland means working for 19,000 people in 32 countries, with a turnover of €1.5 billion by 2023:

- Technical and human support for each project and effective career management
- Training to develop your professional skills
- Take part in special dedicated events
- Join a dynamic team

As a valued member of the Data Engineering team, you will play a crucial role in overseeing the maintenance and
optimization of data pipelines within the Databricks platform. Your primary responsibilities will encompass
addressing evolving business requirements, refining ETL processes, and ensuring the seamless flow of energy data
across our systems.

Key... Responsibilities:
1. Design, Develop, and Maintain Robust Data Workflows:
• Create and maintain scalable data workflows on Databricks integrated with AWS.
• Collaborate closely with cloud and frontend teams to unify data sources and establish a coherent data
model.
2. Ensure Data Pipeline Reliability and Performance:
• Guarantee the availability, integrity, and performance of data pipelines.
• Proactively monitor workflows to maintain high data quality.
3. Collaborate for Data-Driven Insights:
• Engage with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities for data-driven enhancements and insights.
• Analyze platform performance, identify bottlenecks, and recommend improvements.
4. Documentation and Continuous Learning:
• Develop and maintain comprehensive technical documentation for ETL implementations.
• Stay abreast of the latest Databricks/Spark features and best practices, contributing to the continuous
improvement of our data management capabilities.

Qualifications:

• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Technical Skills:
• Strong expertise in PySpark.
• Proficiency in SQL and scripting languages (e.g., Python).
• Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Strong communication skills in French (both written and verbal) and fluency in English.

Additional Preferred Skills:
• Familiarity with industry-specific regulations and compliance requirements.
• Previous experience in the energy trading domain is a nice-to-have.
6. Personal Attributes:
• Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
• Detail-oriented with effective task prioritization skills.
• Demonstrated adaptability and a keen willingness to learn new technologies and tools.
• Strong customer orientation.

Minimum of 5 years as a Data Engineer, with a proven track record of implementing pipelines inDatabricks
Experience in cloud environments (AWS or Azure) is a plus.

Fluent english required, advanced French is a plus

title: DATA QUALITY ENGINEER
description:
Expleo offers a unique range of integrated engineering, quality and strategic consulting services for digital transformation. At a time of unprecedented technological acceleration, we are the trusted partner of innovative companies. We help them develop a competitive advantage and improve the daily lives of millions of people.

Joining Expleo Switzerland means working for 19,000 people in 32 countries, with a turnover of €1.5 billion by 2023:

- Technical and human support for each project and effective career management
- Training to develop your professional skills
- Take part in special dedicated events
- Join a dynamic team

We are looking for a Data Quality Engineer to offer a great opportunity to work in a team dedicated for data continuity and data quality support.

As a member of a team located in Geneva, you will have a chance to:
• Develop and implement data quality standards, policies, and procedures to ensure the accuracy and integrity of our data assets.
• Collaborate... with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and define data quality metrics.
• Design and execute data quality checks, validation processes, and data cleansing routines.
• Identify and investigate data quality issues, providing timely resolution and root cause analysis.
• Identify operational problems by observing and studying the functioning and performance of systems.
• Develop and maintain data quality dashboards and reports for ongoing monitoring and reporting.
• Develop operational solutions by defining, studying, estimating, and testing alternative approaches.
• Collaborate with data architects and engineers to integrate data quality measures into the overall data architecture.
• Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging trends in data quality management.
• Provide operational management information by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing operating and engineering trends.
• Anticipate operational problems by studying operating targets, modes of operation, and unit limitations.
• Maintain safe and healthy work environment by following and enforcing standards and procedures and complying with legal regulations.

your qualifications:
• Finished higher education in IT.
• Certifications in data management or quality assurance.
• Understanding of data streaming and data driven architectures.
• Proficient in data profiling, cleansing, and validation techniques.
• Strong SQL skills for querying and analyzing data.
• Familiarity with data governance frameworks and principles.
• Strong understanding of operations, services, and applications.
• Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Knowledge of data privacy and compliance standards.
• Proven experience as a Data Quality Engineer or in a similar role for 3 years in banking sector . Experience with data quality tools and platforms

title: Test Data Scientist Expert
description:
Critères de l'offre
• *L'entreprise**: LHH

The Adecco Group Switzerland

Description du poste

For one of our clients a banking company, in Geneva, we are recruiting for a long-term mission a Test Data Scientist Expert who is open-minded and client-oriented, is passionate about his work, who believes in success and has a strong team spirit. Are you looking for you next challenging position? This opportunity is for you
• *Responsibilities**:
As a Test Data Scientist Expert, you define test strategies and adapting test plan according to project and customer needs. You coordinate testing activities on private bank domains. You develop the test plans, you identify dependencies and resources required to run a test phase. Moreover, you communicate findings and insights with projects stakeholders using data analytical and virtualization techniques. You assist the Business with User acceptance testing. You define test scenarios, execute test cases, and analyze results. You manage test data... and coordinate tests. You manage multiple several projects and you coordinate and manager user acceptance testing. You define test phases with the project team and you manage testing dashboards and generate dashboard.

Profile

Bachelor IT
At least 5 years' experience in data (data scientist, data analyst)
Experience in testing
Excellent analytical skills
English and French

title: Client Data Analyst - Private Banking - 6 months - FR/ENG
description:
About Our Client

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytically skilled Client Data Analyst for a prestigious private bank in Geneva.

Job Description
• Collect, process, and analyze client data to support business decisions.
• Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using advanced Excel functionalities.
• Collaborate with internal teams to identify and address data analysis needs.
• Ensure accuracy and integrity of data through thorough validation and cross-checking.
• Present analytical insights to stakeholders in a clear and coherent manner.
• Participate in the design and implementation of data management processes.

The Successful Applicant
• 0-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
• Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, functions, and macros).
• Fluency in French and English is mandatory.
• Solid understanding of financial concepts and terminology.
• Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related field is... preferred.
• Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
• Proven ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
• Legally entitled to work in Switzerland.

What's on Offer
• Opportunity to work with a leading private bank in a dynamic, international environment.
• Competitive remuneration package.
• Professional growth opportunities with the potential for contract renewal and long-term career development

title: Data analyst (H/F)
description:
Introduction

Pour notre division Système d’Information, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) afin de rejoindre le groupe Data Analytics, au sein duquel il aura la responsabilité de mettre en place et d'administrer les outils de reporting pour Rolex, Tudor et leurs filiales tout en animant la communauté de Business Intelligence Self-Service.

Responsabilités
• Participer à la conception des outils de reporting
• Développer les tableaux de bord et outils d’analyse de données
• Définir et réaliser les flux d’alimentation de données du Data Warehouse
• Optimiser les sources de données pour une bonne expérience utilisateur
• Orienter les évolutions des Data Warehouses et des outils de visualisation de données
• Promouvoir l’utilisation des outils self-service BI dans la communauté via des communications et des formations
• Apporter le support niveau 3 sur les outils de reporting
• Maitriser l’architecture technique des environnements BI et la faire évoluer avec les équipes Plateforme
•... Gérer différents projets de déploiement
• Assurer une veille technologique dans les domaines de la BI

Profil
• Formation universitaire dans le domaine informatique, ingénierie EPF
• Minimum 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire
• Bonnes connaissances en modélisation et développement BI
• Sensibilité forte en Data Visualisation
• Bonnes compétences Tableau, SAP BW, Snowflake
• Connaissance des techniques de traitement de données (transformation, profilage, visualisation)
• Sens du relationnel, rigueur et autonomie
• Compétences linguistiques : français courant avec une bonne maîtrise de l’anglais

Conclusion

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

#LI-Hybrid
job_highlights:
[{'items': ["Introduction

Pour notre division Système d’Information, nous recherchons un Data Analyst (H/F) afin de rejoindre le groupe Data Analytics, au sein duquel il aura la responsabilité de mettre en place et d'administrer les outils de reporting pour Rolex, Tudor et leurs filiales tout en animant la communauté de Business Intelligence Self-Service.

Responsabilités
• Participer à la conception des outils de reporting
• Développer les tableaux de bord et outils d’analyse de données
• Définir et réaliser les flux d’alimentation de données du Data Warehouse
• Optimiser les sources de données pour une bonne expérience utilisateur
• Orienter les évolutions des Data Warehouses et des outils de visualisation de données
• Promouvoir l’utilisation des outils self-service BI dans la communauté via des communications et des formations
• Apporter le support niveau 3 sur les outils de reporting
• Maitriser l’architecture technique des environnements BI et la faire évoluer avec les équipes Plateforme
•... Gérer différents projets de déploiement
• Assurer une veille technologique dans les domaines de la BI

Profil
• Formation universitaire dans le domaine informatique, ingénierie EPF
• Minimum 3 ans d'expérience dans un rôle similaire
• Bonnes connaissances en modélisation et développement BI
• Sensibilité forte en Data Visualisation
• Bonnes compétences Tableau, SAP BW, Snowflake
• Connaissance des techniques de traitement de données (transformation, profilage, visualisation)
• Sens du relationnel, rigueur et autonomie
• Compétences linguistiques : français courant avec une bonne maîtrise de l’anglais

Conclusion

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

#LI-Hybrid"]}]

title: Impact Data Analyst
description:
Your team

Pictet Asset Management manages the assets of some of the world’s largest institutions, financial intermediaries and their clients. Our culture welcomes independent thinkers and centres on investment excellence, a long-term perspective and dedication to client service.
We are seeking to recruit an Impact Data Analyst for our Thematic Equities team to help further develop industry-leading thematic impact measurement tools. The successful candidate will work closely with our Thematic Impact and Thematic Investment teams.

Your role
• Working with teams across the organisation to develop the models, tools and data underlying our thematic investment process, and ensuring they are kept up to date.
• Ensuring a strong link between bottom-up company fundamentals and top-down modelling.
• Helping the growth of institutional client solutions through advanced reporting.
• Providing tools, support and training for investment teams and external stakeholders.
• Developing and... maintaining insightful and user-friendly Tableau dashboards for our investment teams.
• Developing insightful data visualisations for our sustainability reports and thematic product presentations.
• Attending ad-hoc client meetings as subject matter expert.
• Acting as a interface between IT, AI Analytics and the Thematic Equities team.
• Managing projects, taking ownership and driving them to successful completion.

Your profile
• An MSc or PhD preferably in the field of science or engineering.
• Good understanding of LCA and EIO (EEMRIO) concepts and associated modelling.
• Experience with Python, Data Science packages (e.g. pandas, SciPy) and relational database programming (SQL).
• An affinity to fundamental company analysis.
• Strong communication skills; Fluent in English (native or equivalent a plus).
• Passion for data visualisation; experience with Tableau a plus.
• Must have an interest in sustainability and the equity market.
• Previous exposure to statistical modelling, machine learning or NLP a plus.
• Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate.

Note
We will not accept any CVs via agencies
Diversity & Inclusion

Pictet is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse environment. We respect all individuals and seek their inclusion in the workplace

title: Power BI Data Analyst
description:
Title: Power BI Data Analyst

Type: fixed-contract (9 months)

Location: Geneva, Meyrin

Start date: May 2024

About us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, execute large scale transformations and implement AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We’re on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations . Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we’re all in awe of – our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Power BI Data Analyst specializing in data visualization, your mission is to leverage your expertise to transform complex datasets into meaningful and actionable insights to drive informed business decisions. You will be... responsible for creating impactful visualizations by leveraging various data sources ingested into Snowflake, and utilizing Power BI to create visualizations.

What you will be responsible for

As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for:
• Expertise in transforming complex datasets into meaningful and actionable insights.
• Proficiency in creating impactful visualizations using Power BI.
• Experience in leveraging various data sources within Snowflake for visualization purposes.
• Capability to gather requirements from diverse audiences for data visualization.
• Collaboration skills with both business and technical teams to enhance data-driven decision-making processes.
• Proficiency in automating reporting processes.
• Contributing to driving business growth and improving operational efficiency through data insights.

Depending on your previous experiences and appetite to grow, you will play an active role in practice development.

What we are looking for
• 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst / BI developer
• Power BI Data Analyst Certification is mandatory
• Proven track in transforming abstract questions into quantifiable metrics
• Experience in the luxury manufacturing industry
• SQL proficiency
• Experience with Snowflake
• Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and French.

What we offer
• A competitive compensation package
• A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
• A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
• A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
• A position that enables you to have an impact on 1’000s of people, and the whole company's growth.
• An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset

Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don’t hesitate to contact us if you have any questions

title: Data Analyst logistique [H/F/X]
description:
Vous êtes à la recherche d'un nouveau défi passionnant dans le domaine de l'horlogerie ?

Nous avons une opportunité unique pour vous ! Pour répondre aux besoins de nos clients, nous sommes à la recherche d'un

DATA ANALYST LOGISTIQUE

Responsabilités
• Participer aux projets logistiques intégrant une expertise en analyse de données
• Comprendre les problématiques métier et les traduire de manière analytique
• Cartographier des flux et identifier les données et points de mesure pertinents
• Extraire les données de systèmes sources (SAP, MES, LES, Equipements)
• Travailler les données collectées pour les rendre exploitables et maitriser leur qualité
• Mener des analyses de données, utiliser des modèles de simulation, afin de dégager des orientations ou optimisations logistiques
• Créer des tableaux de bord et des indicateurs de mesure
• Communiquer les résultats de manière accessible avec des outils de data visualisation
• Effectuer de la veille sur les outils d’analyse et de... simulation

Votre profil
• Ingénieur HES, EPF ou équivalent en logistique
• Connaissance des outils d’analyse de données (Python, R, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données (SQL)
• Simulation de flux logistique un plus
• Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie
• Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace
• Dynamisme, flexibilité et esprit d'équipe

Bénéfices
• Des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail
• Des prestations sociales de premier ordre
• Restaurant d'entreprise

Contact

Si vous avez d'autres questions concernant cette offre d'emploi (référence : JN -042024-590149), - Vos conseillers Adecco Watch Technology

À propos de nous

Adecco est le leader du marché des solutions en matière de personnel en Suisse et dans le monde. Chaque jour, nos équipes présentes sur une cinquantaine de sites dans toute la Suisse assurent la meilleure compatibilité entre les candidats et les clients dans différents domaines professionnels et secteurs. Adecco Suisse est une société du Groupe Adecco, n° 1 mondial du domaine des ressources humaines. Nous aspirons à faciliter l’insertion professionnelle de chacun et employons tous les jours plus de 3,5 millions de personnes. Nous recrutons, développons et formons des talents dans 60 pays, et nous aidons les entreprises à façonner l’avenir du travail.
[ A133 - 133 - AWA - SERM - LACZ - CLGE - LEAY ]

title: Data Analyst - Marketing (6-month contract)
description: Faire carrière chez Lombard Odier, c'est travailler pour un gestionnaire de fortune et d'actifs de renommée mondiale, avec un intérêt et des convictions marquées pour l’investissement durable. Banque innovante de référence pour les clients privés et institutionnels, notre Maison est indépendante et entièrement détenue par ses Associés-gérants. Nous sommes l'un des groupes bancaires les mieux capitalisés au monde, assurant la gestion de près de 300 milliards de francs suisses et opérant depuis plus de 25 bureaux répartis sur quatre continents. Forte de plus de 225 années d’expériences, Lombard Odier s’est établie comme une Maison d’investissement de référence offrant une large gamme de services de gestion de portefeuille discrétionnaire et conseillée, de gestion patrimoniale et de banque de dépôt. Nous offrons également nos services de gestion d’actifs et de stratégie d’investissement à travers notre entité Lombard Odier Investment Managers, ainsi que des solutions technologiques... bancaires de pointe à d’autres institutions financières. « Rethink Everything » est notre philosophie. Elle est au cœur de toutes nos activités. Nous sommes devenus plus forts en traversant plus de 40 crises financières, en réévaluant et en repensant constamment le monde qui nous entoure pour offrir de nouvelles perspectives d’investissement à nos clients. Data Analyst - Marketing (6-months contract) As part of the Marketing & Communication department, you will join the Digital Marketing team in charge of several platform and in particular our website www.lombardodier.com YOUR MISSION Creation and modification of Looker Studio Dashboard Analyse website traffic and its sources Prepare regular reports for management using data from analytics platform. Response to ad hoc data requests YOUR PROFILE Degree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent experience Knowledge of Business Intelligence Dashboarding tool (Looker Studio preferred) and Analytic platform (Google Analytics 4 preferred) Interest in Marketing Digital domain Strong analytical skills and rigor in data processing Team player with strong communication skills Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills Oral and written in French and English Resident in Switzerland L’ADN de notre Maison est défini par cinq valeurs fondamentales. L’Excellence nous conduit à être les meilleurs dans ce que nous entreprenons, tandis que l’Innovation nourrit nos progrès et notre esprit pionnier. Le Respect guide chacune de nos interactions, et l’Intégrité façonne nos actions. Ensemble, nous formons une seule équipe, One Team, unie pour servir nos clients avec un dévouement sans faille. Si vous vous reconnaissez dans cette description de poste, nous serions heureux de recevoir votre candidature. Celle-ci sera traitée avec une confidentialité absolue. Aidez-nous à construire la banque de demain. Lombard Odier a pour objectif de préserver et de faire fructifier le patrimoine de ses clients dans le temps. Avec plus de 220 ans d’histoire, nous sommes au service de nos clients depuis plus de sept générations. Nous avons ainsi surmonté 40 crises financières et n’avons cessé d’innover pour offrir des services durables et de premier ordre à nos clients. Notre engagement envers vous. Lombard Odier est un employeur de choix. Nous nous engageons à offrir un environnement de travail stimulant et encourageons la créativité et l’innovation pour développer les opportunités d’affaires et l’efficacité. Notre culture. Chez Lombard Odier, nous savons que le personnel est une ressource précieuse. C’est pourquoi nous tenons à créer une atmosphère qui permet à chaque individu de s’épanouir et de contribuer à la réalisation de nos objectifs. Mettre en place un cadre dans lequel nos équipes peuvent trouver l’inspiration, « tout repenser » et s’épanouir dans un environnement positif et énergique fait partie de notre ADN. Diversité et inclusion. En notre qualité d’employeur, il nous tient à cœur de favoriser l’égalité des chances. Certifiés EDGE (Economic Dividends for Gender Equality), nous voulons créer un lieu de travail optimal pour tout le monde et aider les hommes et les femmes à en tirer parti, sans discrimination. EDGE représente la principale norme mondiale d’analyse des processus de promotion de l’égalité des sexes dans le monde du travail. formation. Si nos employés s’améliorent, nous nous améliorons. C’est pourquoi, chez Lombard Odier, nous offrons tout le soutien dont les collaborateurs ont besoin pour prendre en main leur propre développement, tant personnel que professionnel. Cela traduit notre volonté de reconnaître et de promouvoir les talents de chacun de nos collaborateurs dans le respect de nos valeurs. Notre programme de formation est diversifié et de qualité. Il se distingue par notre engagement à valoriser et à promouvoir les compétences et le savoir-faire de chacun

title: Junior Data Analyst H/F/X
description:
Nous recherchons pour notre client un Junior Data Analyst H/F/X dans le cadre d'une mission de 6 mois.

Missions:

-Mettre en ?uvre des stratégies d'assainissement des données en identifiant, en analysant et en résolvant les problèmes de données dans les systèmes bancaires.

?Collaborer avec les équipes informatiques pour élaborer et mettre en ?uvre des stratégies de nettoyage et de migration des données.

-Collaborer avec diverses équipes pour élaborer et mettre en ?uvre des initiatives d'amélioration de la qualité des données.

-Élaborer et tenir à jour des plans de correction des données

-Concevoir et mettre en ?uvre des procédures de validation des données afin de garantir l'exactitude et l'exhaustivité des efforts de correction des données.

qualifications

Vous êtes diplômé d'une formation en finance ou comptabilité.

Vous maîtrisez le français et l'anglais impérativement et avez des bases solides sur Excel.

Nous recherchons avant tout un profil junior (entre 0 et 2 ans... d'expérience dans un rôle similaire) motivé et avec une grande capacité analytique.

Le ou la candidat.e devra résider sur sol Suisse obligatoirement.

Poste à pourvoir immédiatement

Le ou la candidat.e devra résider sur sol Suisse obligatoirement.

Poste à pourvoir immédiatement"]}]

title: Data Analyst
description:
Tu as récemment obtenu ton diplôme et tu souhaites débuter ta carrière dans le secteur bancaire? Tu aimes ce qui est lié à la gestion de la donnée et tu as un intérêt pour la finance et les investissements? On dit de toi que tu es rigoureux et tu fais attention aux détails? N'attends plus c'est une opportunité à ne pas rater!

Localisation: Genève

Catégorie du poste: IT

Durée: Temps plein, mission d'une année

Date de début: Dès que possible

Type de travail: Mission

Tu intègreras une équipe en place, active dans la data et tu participeras à l'acquisition des données liées aux investissements alternatifs. C'est une chance d'intégrer un département dynamique et de développer tes connaissances.

Ce processus de recrutement est géré par Academic Work et notre client souhaite que toutes les questions concernant le poste soient adressées à Academic Work.

Notre processus de sélection est continu et l'annonce peut être clôturée avant la fin du processus de recrutement si nous sommes... passés à la phase suivante.

Lorsque vous postulez à cette offre, vous rejoignez les nombreux consultants d’Academic Work. Vous profiterez de nombreux bénéfices mais aurez aussi une équipe de Consultant Manager pour vous soutenir dans cette étape de votre carrière.En apprendre plus sur Academic Work

Nadina Marques ou un-e de nos collègues de l'équipe recrutement vous répondra par e-mail sur l'adresse Écrire un email Merci de préciser le numéro de l'offre dans votre e-mail: 15104570

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 7 jours

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 10 jours

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 18 jours

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 22 jours

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.

More information

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising

title: Ad operation / BA or Data Analyst Digital Advertising 80-100%
description:
À propos de notre client

Notre client est une agence media Suisse 360 basée en plein centre de Genève (10 à pied de la gare)

Au sein d'une équipe digitale passionnée et soudée, vous travaillerez dans une ambiance où le travail en équipe, la cohésion, l'humilité sont les facteurs clés de succès. Vous pourrez apprendre, vous développer et grandir au sein de cette agence.

Description du poste

Vous aurez la chance de pouvoir faire la passation avec la personne qui part en congés maternité, vos missions seront les suivants :
• Mettre en ligne, suivre et évaluer les campagnes digitales planifiées au sein de l'agence.
• Garantir des prestations de haute qualité, innovantes et orientées client.
• Travailler en collaboration avec les équipes dans leurs missions d'agrégation de données et créations d'outils de reporting (sous forme Google Sheet / Dashboard Looker).
• Etablir les plans de production digitaux, puis superviser la production des moyens publicitaires avec les agences de... production conformément aux spécifications.
• Effectuer des mises en place de campagnes dans les plateformes d'adserving, vérifier la conformité et charger les moyens publicitaires dans celles-ci.
• Coordonner la mise en place du tracking souhaité en coordination avec les interlocuteurs concernés côté client.
• Contrôler régulièrement la livraison des campagnes confiées et intervenir auprès du Media Planner ou du média concerné quand cela est nécessaire.
• Mettre à disposition des responsables des Media Planners les rapports intermédiaires et finaux des campagnes digitales et échanger avec eux autour de ceux-ci.

A quoi peut ressembler votre semaine type ?

En début de semaine, au lancement des campagnes, vous vous assurez de la livraison des campagnes, analysez les activités afin de pouvoir les partager avec les clients.

En milieu de semaine : vous livrez les reporting intermédiaires pour que les planners en tirer des conclusions et puissent les partager avec le client

En fin de semaine : vous contribuez à la mise en place des campagnes qui commencent la semaine suivante.

Profil recherché
• Formation professionnelle attestée (type brevet fédéral) dans les domaines du digital, de la communication et / ou dans l'analyse de données.
• Expérience confirmée de gestion de campagnes digitales / Ad Ops/ Business Analyst/ Data Analyst d'au moins 2-3 ans.
• Bonne expérience dans l'analyse et la gestion de données, notamment pluri-sources.
• Maîtrise approfondie des principaux logiciels bureautiques usuels (MS Office), particulièrement Excel, bonnes connaissances de Google Sheet et Looker / Dashboard.
• Des connaissances de Google Analytics 4 seraient idéales.
• Fort attrait pour les chiffres, l'analyse et les agrégations de données ainsi que de solides capacités analytiques :Data mapping
• Connaissance d'au moins une langue nationale et de l'anglais (B2) pour échanger à l'oral et à l'écrit de manière quotidienne.
• Sens de la diplomatie dans les contacts au sein de l'agence, avec les agences de production et avec les clients.
• Un fort esprit d'équipe et une bonne capacité d'adaptation aux imprévus ainsi qu'un vif intérêt pour la recherche de solutions / résolution de problèmes divers et variés.
• Informations complémentaires

Contrat temporaire en remplacement de congés maternité avec possibilité d'embauche par la suite

Home office possible partiellement après la période d'intégration

title: CRM/ Data analyst
description:
You are passionate about fragrances and storytelling?

You are curious about the world?

You want to see your ideas happen within an in-house creative department?

You want to manage a niche perfume brand from A to Z?

You want to join an innovative and fast-growing LUXURY company based in Geneva?

This is your opportunity!

MEMO INTERNATIONAL is a family fragrance group established in 2007 with a portfolio of 3 niche perfume brands Memo Paris, Floraiku Paris and Hermetica Paris. We’re a company that genuinely cares about our people, our products, our clients, and the environment. High energy, creativity and an entrepreneurial spirit are essential qualities that animate every member of our team every day. We are poets. We are curious about the world. We love fragrances, we love to dream. If you have great eye, the ability to capture and highlight products and a quick learning pace, we want you on our team!

Position Summary

We are seeking a CRM/Data Analyst to join our Digital Team... at Memo International. As an integral member of our dynamic team, your role will encompass enhancing the visibility of our brand across digital platforms globally, aiming to meet our brand and sales objectives. You will be responsible for the meticulous analysis of digital data, including CRM and eCommerce metrics, to ensure strategic alignment and performance optimization. Your duties will also include ensuring the flawless execution and adherence to Memo International's brand standards online, maintaining the same level of excellence as our offline channels. Additionally, you will use data-driven insights to contribute to providing the optimal online experience by enhancing brand representation and the shopping experience on our own website and on our physical point of sales.

What You Will Do

Campaign and Content Calendar Management
• Ecommerce Marketing Calendar Oversight: Manage the ecommerce marketing calendar to include promotions, website content, emails, SMS. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to ensure that ecommerce content are align with the overall brand strategy while achieving traffic and sales targets.
• Content Supervision: Oversee the site content process, which includes creating creative briefs, reviewing and providing feedback on creative assets, coordinating with our in-house creative team, and ensuring error-free content is deployed across the website, CRM and all marketing channels.
• Analytical Optimization: Utilize analytical insights to boost the visibility of the brand on digital platforms internationally, working closely with marketing and sales teams to synchronize digital strategies with brand and sales objectives.

Digital Marketing Expert
• Execution of CRM Marketing Strategies: Implement best-in-class digital marketing practices that balance brand storytelling with effective sales tactics. Optimize owned channels (email and sms) and collaborate with external experts as necessary.
• Third-Party Marketing Partnerships: Manage relationships with third-party marketing partners, including those for paid ads and affiliates. Keep them informed about campaigns, product launches, and KPI targets, ensuring they deliver optimal consumer experiences with a test-and-learn approach.
• Innovative Practices and A/B Testing: Stay abreast of the latest innovations in digital marketing and ecommerce technologies through webinars, industry journals, and competitive benchmarking. Identify opportunities for A/B testing of copy and visual content, sharing and implementing learnings.

Lead & Manage
• Cross-Functional Team Leadership: Cultivate strong relationships with cross-functional teams across Brand Management, Creative, Commercial, and Finance. Measuring goals and ensuring deliverables are met.
• Performance Reporting: Regularly prepare detailed reports on the performance of digital platforms and initiatives. Communicate findings and strategic recommendations to the Digital Team and relevant stakeholders.
• Collaborative Project Management: Work closely with team members on projects aimed at enhancing the digital presence and effectiveness of the brand. Participate in cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of digital strategies with overall business objectives.

What We’re Looking For
• Master's degree from a top school
• Minimum 3+ years combined work experience in CRM, digital marketing and/or brand marketing, with approved customer activation in luxury industry
• Strong understanding of best-in-class digital marketing and ecommerce practices.
• Advanced analytical skills with the ability to interpret and translate data into action. Advanced Excel skills required.
• Experience with ecommerce platforms such as Klaviyo and Shopify.
• Experience interfacing with digital marketing tools such as email and SMS.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills with an apt for influencing and storytelling.
• Experience leading direct and indirect teams.

Our group is an equal opportunity employer with a diverse, globally distributed workforce.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, nationality, age or any other characteristic protected by law and our values.

MEMO INTERNATIONAL: bringing beauty to the world, through a responsible and inspiring work environment

• Experience interfacing with digital marketing tools such as email and SMS.
• Strong written and verbal communication skills with an apt for influencing and storytelling.
• Experience leading direct and indirect teams.

Our group is an equal opportunity employer with a diverse, globally distributed workforce.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, sexual orientation, nationality, age or any other characteristic protected by law and our values.

MEMO INTERNATIONAL: bringing beauty to the world, through a responsible and inspiring work environment"]}]

title: Senior Business and Data Analyst, Geneve
description:
IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING APPLICATION DEADLINE : please note that the deadline for applications is indicated in local time as per the time zone of the applicant’s location.

1. Organizational Context

a. Organizational Setting

The position is located in the HR Data and Technology Unit of the Human Resources Operations Service, Human Resources Management Department. The HR Data and Technology Unit leads the digital transformation efforts of HRMD in the area of people analytics, drives the simplification, modernization and digitalization of HR-related business processes and facilitates the coordination, implementation and maintenance of HR-related IT-solutions.

b. Purpose Statement

The Senior Business and Data Analyst is expected to develop effective reporting tools for HR data and analytics on talent management, to redesign and digitalize HR-related business processes and to coordinate the development of HR-related IT solutions, all in close cooperation with the business owners and... WIPO's IT system delivery teams.

c. Reporting Lines

The Senior Business and Data Analyst reports to the Manager, HR Data and Technology Unit.

d. Working Relations

The incumbent works closely with colleagues from the Talent Management Service and HR Operations as well as other stakeholders across the Organization, especially with WIPO's IT system delivery teams.

2. Duties and Responsibilities

The incumbent will perform the following principal duties:

a. Develop a strategic vision and roadmap for people analytics to provide HRMD and business leaders with greater access and visibility to human capital data and analytics.

b. Identify needs in relation to data collections, analyze talent management data, develop models, identify trends and apply story-telling approaches, that contribute to the organizations capacity to make informed decisions on HR-related matters.

c. Design, prototype, test and implement effective reporting tools in close cooperation with WIPO's IT system delivery teams, that provide HRMD, WIPO business leaders and external stakeholders with the necessary insights on human capital data and analytics.

d. Lead the analysis and documentation of current HR-related business processes and user journeys, propose improvements and optimizations for streamlining those and identify indicators to measure benefits.

e. Propose and implement suitable tools and techniques including further automation of employee and manager self-service processes to enhance employee experience.

f. Identify and analyze evolving business needs, gather and document user requirements for HR-related IT tools and prioritize its implementation.

g. Work in close cooperation with WIPO's IT system delivery teams on drafting detailed specifications, prototyping, user testing and implementation of changes to HR-related IT solutions to ensure that tools are built and enhanced according to business needs.

h. Perform other duties as required.

3. Requirements

Education (Essential)

Advanced University degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or related field. A first-level university degree plus two years of relevant experience in addition to the experience requested below may be acceptable in lieu of an advanced university degree.

Experience (Essential)

At least seven years of relevant professional work experience, of which at least three years in working with data, in the business intelligence, analytics and data science field.

Experience with visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.

Experience in using tools to document Use Case Diagrams, Data and Process Flow Diagrams etc.

Experience in managing projects.

Experience (Desirable)

Experience with HR data, systems and processes, in particular in supporting an HR function in its digital transformation.

Experience in analyzing data, developing models, identifying trends and applying story-telling approaches in the field of talent management, such as workforce planning, diversity, performance management and employee experience.

Experience with agile project methodologies.

Language (Essential)

Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.

Language (Desirable)

Knowledge of other UN official languages, particularly French.

Job Related Competencies (Essential)

Good understanding of computer systems design, testing and deployment within a large organization.

Critical thinking to balance complex situations and think with a combination of set-in-stone processes and outside-the-box thinking.

Strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills. Ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multi-cultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.

Demonstrated ability to handle confidential and sensitive information in an appropriate manner.

Job Related Competencies (Desirable)

Knowledge of data science languages such as R, Python, SPARK, MATLAB etc.

4. Organizational Competencies

1. Communicating effectively.

2. Showing team spirit.

3. Demonstrating integrity

title: Junior HR Data Analyst (m/f/d)
company_name: Le petit-fils de L.U. Chopard & Cie SA
description:
Reconnue pour son savoir-faire en Haute Horlogerie et Haute Joaillerie, Chopard est célébrée pour son audace créative et sa conception d’un luxe éthique et responsable. Fière de ses valeurs et de ses traditions, notre Maison insuffle son esprit de famille dans ses relations avec ses employés comme avec ses clients, œuvrant à offrir une expérience de marque extraordinaire.

Chopard peut s'appuyer sur un vaste réservoir interne d'expertise et de savoir-faire réunissant plus de 45 métiers différents tant dans la tradition horlogère suisse, que la joaillerie.

Mission du poste

Le Junior HR Data Analyst collecte, analyse et interprète les données pour fournir des informations stratégiques et participer à la formulation de recommandations en matière de gestion des ressources humaines, favorisant ainsi la prise de décisions éclairées et l'amélioration des processus RH.

Tâches & responsabilités
• Collecter et consolider les données relatives aux effectifs, à la rémunération, aux avantages... sociaux, à la performance, et à d’autres domaines des Ressources Humaines
• Analyser les données pour identifier les tendances, les modèles et les observations significatives liés à la gestion des talents, à la rétention des employés, à la diversité et à l’inclusion, et à d’autres domaines RH
• Développer et produire des rapports, des tableaux de bord et des visualisations pour présenter les résultats de manière claire et significative aux parties prenantes concernées
• Participer au projet de gouvernance des données en tant que HR Data Steward : assurer la qualité, l’intégrité et la conformité des données tout en facilitant leur utilisation efficace par les utilisateurs. Identifier, prioriser, construire et mettre en œuvre les HR business use cases (depuis l’identification des données jusqu’à la réalisation du dashboard final)
• Concevoir et gérer des enquêtes auprès des employés, notamment l’enquête sur l’engagement des collaborateurs. Collecter et analyses des données, interpréter des résultats et présenter des conclusions aux parties prenantes
• Réaliser les audits pour identifier des anomalies dans les données RH et garantir l’exactitude des données
• Identifier les opportunités d’amélioration des processus et des politiques RH en s’appuyant sur l’analyse des données.

Compétences requises

Savoir-faire

Savoir-être
• Diplôme Bachelor ou Master: HES - UNI - EPF - HEG - HEC
• Solides compétences analytiques (statistiques et outils d’analyse de données)
• Gestion de projet
• Expertise MS Office - particulièrement Excel
• Langue : français, anglais impératif, allemand ou une autre langue un atout
• Sens esthétique et de la mise en page
• Connaissances de base des règles de mise en page et de typographie et des techniques de production
• Excellentes capacités organisationnelles et logistiques (maîtrise de la planification)
• Excellentes compétences en communication verbale et écrite, et de synthèse
• Efficacité, rigueur
• Organisation
• Capacité d’adaptation
• Créativité, inventivité
• Autonomie
• Esprit d’équipe

La liste des responsabilités et des activités liée à ce descriptif de poste n'est pas exhaustive.
Jetzt bewerbenTeilenStelle speichern

title: Data analyst
description:
Le présent et le futur d'Audemars Piguet se construisent grâce à la contribution de tous nos talents. Inspirés par la richesse de notre passé, nous sommes enthousiastes à l'idée de ce que nous créerons dans le futur. Ensemble, nous sommes résolument tournés vers l'avenir et en quête continue d'excellence dans tous nos métiers.
Si notre mission vous inspire, venez forger votre propre chemin au sein de notre famille pour que l'on continue de créer l'extraordinaire. Écrivons le prochain chapitre de votre carrière ensemble !
Description du poste Rattaché au Data Office et partie prenante de l'équipe IT/Digital, le occupe un rôle clé au sein du Data Office et sera un interlocuteur privilégié des équipes métiers. Il interviendra pour recueillir, analyser et challenger leurs demandes. Réel support fonctionnel, il est en mesure d'appréhender rapidement les différentes problématiques métiers soumis, et d'établir les premiers livrables clés nécessaires à la mise en oeuvre de leurs demandes
Dans... ce cadre-là :
• Vous êtes capable de conduire des ateliers fonctionnels de recueil et d'analyser des besoins et en assurez la restitution,
• Vous collaborerez étroitement avec les équipes métiers producteurs et utilisateurs de données pour définir les objets métiers exposés et assurerez du niveau de documentation associé,
• Vous définirez et cartographierez les relations entre objets à un niveau conceptuel en collaboration avec la cellule architecture,
• Vous donnerez les moyens concrets de faire évoluer la stratégie des actions de l'équipe Data en se basant sur les données collectées,
• Vous remonterez au Data Architect les besoins en termes de structuration et d'intégration de données,
• Vous coordonnerez les analyses effectuées et les problèmes rencontrés avec le Data Scientist afin de lui donner de la visibilité.
Qualifications
• Au bénéfice d'une formation Bac + 4 à Bac + 5 dans le domaine de l'ingénierie informatique et/ou des études statistiques, vous justifiez d'une première expérience en qualité d'Analyste/ Data Scientist / Data engineer,
• Vous avez d'excellente connaissance des environnements d'ensembles de données importants, des bases de données relationnelles (SQL), des logiciels de reporting,
• Vous avez des compétences en visualisation de données (Tableau, PowerBI ou autres) et en cartographie des données et/ou Data Catalog,
• Vous avez une bonne connaissance de l'industrie horlogère,
• Vous avez une bonne capacité à travailler en équipes projets transverses avec des intervenants internes et externes, y compris à l'international et vous savez vulgariser les concepts techniques,
• Vous avez un sens de la rigueur, de la confidentialité en raison de la sensibilité de certaines données et avez une aisance relationnelle,
• Vous maîtrisez parfaitement le français et avez de très bonnes connaissances de l'anglais.
Informations supplémentaires Ce que nous offrons :
• Les assurances maladie (base et complémentaire)
• 5 semaines annuelles de congé avec 2 semaines supplémentaires entre Noël et Nouvel An grâce au cumul quotidien de minutes additionnelles ;
• Des coachings sportifs individuels et en groupe
• Des contributions à vos activités sportives ou culturelles ainsi qu'aux abonnements encourageant la mobilité douce (CFF par exemple)
• Parkings gratuits et recharge offerte pour les voitures électriques ;
• Possibilité de travailler à distance depuis plusieurs sites (GE/VD/NE) ;
• Une LPP avec des taux avantageux
Vous souhaitez exprimer votre expertise au sein d'Audemars Piguet ? N'hésitez pas et postulez en ligne ! Nous nous réjouissons de discuter des opportunités qui pourraient correspondre à votre prochaine aventure professionnelle.
Le masculin vaut pour le féminin

title: Business Performance Analyst
description:
The Business Performance Analyst reports to the Regional Business Performance Senior Analyst, within the Technology & Business Performance department. The position is based in Meyrin (Geneva), in our ‘Campus Genevois de Haute Horlogerie’.

Duration: 12 months (fixed term)

Scope: All Maisons, markets and functions within Richemont Europe (Benelux, France, Iberia, Italy, Northern Europe, Switzerland, UK)

PURPOSE

You will be part of an exciting journey aiming at helping our Group and Maisons in Europe make data driven decisions, by analysing and interpreting large datasets, identifying trends and insights, empowering our community, while ensuring data quality.

RESPONSABILITIES

Reporting

- Prepare recurrent reports for our management ensuring highest level of quality

- Perform ad-hoc analysis to address our stakeholders’ business needs

- Ensure the monthly update of our regional Business Intelligence dashboard in Power BI (macro-economic indicators)

- Ensure the monthly update of... our Network Monitoring dashboard in Power BI, for a proper follow up of our European network and all upcoming projects

- Help Regional Business Performance Senior Analyst in the development of new reports and the enhancement of existing ones, to answer identified business needs

- Support in the development of a transversal dashboard for our regional functions, following main activity drivers and KPIs

Data Quality

- Perform regular cleaning campaigns to ensure the quality of our database

Adoption

- Support the Regional Business Performance Senior Analyst in the preparation and delivery of different actions, aiming at a maximized adoption of our BI tools from our community (ex. trainings, onboarding, glossaries, market visits, regular communication in our internal social channel)

SKILLS

- Business Analyst profile

- Knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (Excel skills mandatory)

- Strong analytical skills: ability to collect, organize, analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

- Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills

- Proactive, show good judgement and come with suggestions & ideas

- Experience with Data visualisation (Data Science is a plus)

- Fluent in English, any other European language a plus

Still wondering why, you should apply?

- You will join a friendly and dynamic team with whom you will be able to share your knowledge and expertise

- Customer focus, collaboration, challenging partnership, trust, integrity and agile learning are part of our great team spirit

- You will interact with several stakeholders across functions and countries

- Our offices will allow you to evolve in a modern and pleasant environment
