title: Data analyst
description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing.

An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents. With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody.

We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provideadvanced banking technology to other financial institutions. “Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do.

We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

Data... Analyst - Marketing (6-months contract)As part of the Marketing & Communication department, you will join the Digital Marketing team in charge of several platform and in particular our website www.lombardodier.com YOUR MISSIONCreation and modification of Looker Studio Dashboard Analyse website traffic and its sources Prepare regular reports for management using data from analytics platform.

Response to ad hoc data requests YOUR PROFILEDegree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent experience Knowledge of Business Intelligence Dashboarding tool (Looker Studio preferred) and Analytic platform (Google Analytics 4 preferred)Interest in Marketing Digital domain Strong analytical skills and rigor in data processing Team player with strong communication skills Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills Oral and written in French and English Resident in Switzerland Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values.

Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress.

Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions.

Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

Should you recognise yourself in this mission statement, we would be happy to receive your application.

It will be handled in the strictest confidence

title: Data Analyst - Marketing (6-month contract)
description:
Data Analyst - Marketing (6-month contract)

Wer sich für eine Karriere bei Lombard Odier entscheidet, ist für einen renommierten, globalen Vermögensverwalter und Asset Manager tätig, der sich auf nachhaltige Investitionen fokussiert. Wir sind eine unabhängige und innovative Bank erster Wahl für private und institutionelle Kunden. Unsere Gruppe ist eine der bestkapitalisierten weltweit. Wir verwalten rund CHF 300 Milliarden und sind auf vier Kontinenten von über 25 Niederlassungen aus tätig.

Mit unserer über 225-jährigen Geschichte sind wir ein Investmenthaus mit umfassendem Angebot an diskretionärer und beratender Portfolioverwaltung sowie Finanzdienstleistungen. Unsere hochmoderne Technologie-Plattform vermarkten wir auch erfolgreich an andere Finanzinstitute. Über Lombard Odier Investment Managers bieten wir Vermögensverwaltungsdienstleistungen und Anlagestrategien an.

"Rethink Everything" ist unsere Philosophie – sie steht im Zentrum unseres Handelns. Wir sind durch mehr als 40... Finanzkrisen stärker geworden, indem wir die Welt um uns herum ständig neu gedacht haben. So bieten wir unseren Kundinnen und Kunden stets neue Anlageperspektiven.

Data Analyst - Marketing (6-months contract)

As part of the Marketing & Communication department, you will join the Digital Marketing team in charge of several platform and in particular our website www.lombardodier.com

YOUR MISSION
• Creation and modification of Looker Studio Dashboard
• Analyse website traffic and its sources
• Prepare regular reports for management using data from analytics platform.
• Response to ad hoc data requests

YOUR PROFILE
• Degree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent experience
• Knowledge of Business Intelligence Dashboarding tool (Looker Studio preferred) and Analytic platform (Google Analytics 4 preferred)
• Interest in Marketing Digital domain
• Strong analytical skills and rigor in data processing
• Team player with strong communication skills
• Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills
• Oral and written in French and English
• Resident in Switzerland

Fünf Werte definieren die DNA unseres Hauses. Exzellenz motiviert uns, die Besten unseres Gebiets zu sein, und Innovation ermöglicht unseren Fortschritt. Respekt ist das Fundament unserer Interaktionen, und Integrität leitet unser Handeln. Gemeinsam sind wir ein Team, das sich mit leidenschaftlichem Engagement in den Dienst unserer Kundinnen und Kunden stellt.

Should you recognise yourself in this mission statement, we would be happy to receive your application. It will be handled in the strictest confidence

[{'items': ['Data Analyst - Marketing (6-month contract)

Wer sich für eine Karriere bei Lombard Odier entscheidet, ist für einen renommierten, globalen Vermögensverwalter und Asset Manager tätig, der sich auf nachhaltige Investitionen fokussiert. Wir sind eine unabhängige und innovative Bank erster Wahl für private und institutionelle Kunden. Unsere Gruppe ist eine der bestkapitalisierten weltweit. Wir verwalten rund CHF 300 Milliarden und sind auf vier Kontinenten von über 25 Niederlassungen aus tätig.

Mit unserer über 225-jährigen Geschichte sind wir ein Investmenthaus mit umfassendem Angebot an diskretionärer und beratender Portfolioverwaltung sowie Finanzdienstleistungen. Unsere hochmoderne Technologie-Plattform vermarkten wir auch erfolgreich an andere Finanzinstitute. Über Lombard Odier Investment Managers bieten wir Vermögensverwaltungsdienstleistungen und Anlagestrategien an.

"Rethink Everything" ist unsere Philosophie – sie steht im Zentrum unseres Handelns. Wir sind durch mehr als 40... Finanzkrisen stärker geworden, indem wir die Welt um uns herum ständig neu gedacht haben. So bieten wir unseren Kundinnen und Kunden stets neue Anlageperspektiven.

Data Analyst - Marketing (6-months contract)

As part of the Marketing & Communication department, you will join the Digital Marketing team in charge of several platform and in particular our website www.lombardodier.com

YOUR MISSION
• Creation and modification of Looker Studio Dashboard
• Analyse website traffic and its sources
• Prepare regular reports for management using data from analytics platform.
• Response to ad hoc data requests

YOUR PROFILE
• Degree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent experience
• Knowledge of Business Intelligence Dashboarding tool (Looker Studio preferred) and Analytic platform (Google Analytics 4 preferred)
• Interest in Marketing Digital domain
• Strong analytical skills and rigor in data processing
• Team player with strong communication skills
• Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills
• Oral and written in French and English
• Resident in Switzerland

title: Senior Data Analyst (Flights team, Bangkok-based, Relocation provided)
description:
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 3.6 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Our Purpose – Bridging the World Through Travel

We believe travel allows people to enjoy, learn and experience more of the amazing world we live in. It brings individuals and cultures closer together, fostering empathy, understanding and happiness.

We are a skillful, driven and diverse team from across the globe, united by a passion to make an impact. Harnessing our innovative technologies and strong partnerships, we aim to make travel easy and rewarding for everyone.

THIS... ROLE IS BASED IN BANGKOK, THAILAND (WITH RELOCATION PROVIDED)

Location: Bangkok, Thailand (*Not open for remote work.)

About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership, enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

Agoda first started selling air tickets in late 2019; we are currently looking to grow the commercial team in North Asia to help grow our young Flights business into a market leader in APAC.

As part of the Flights Team, you will be responsible for identifying new partners and opportunities, cultivating a relationship with them, and working together with them to deliver the best outcome for our end customers. You would also be responsible with managing the day to day interaction with the partner and working closely with other teams within Agoda to ensure the partners needs are met.

We design tailored business and product solutions with our partners and help them generate measurable value. Members of our team are empowered and supported to grow their market(s) or accounts. We develop win-win relationships and leverage Agoda’s unique accommodations portfolio and tech solutions to bring our partners the advantages they seek. Utilizing our strong brand and resources, we build new channels to increase the visibility of Agoda, introduce more travelers to our great products and service and deliver significant revenues to the overall business.

The Opportunity:

As an Analyst/Senior Analyst, you will report directly to either the Senior Manager or Associate Director within the Supply Department and this will be an individual contributor role. You will be responsible and fully empowered to work with the partners on the ground. You will be supported by a team within the Supply department and work closely with other Flight Commercial Team members within Agoda.

You will have the opportunity to be part of an exciting and brand new team and new business vertical for Agoda and have the rare opportunity of joining a ‘start-up’ within an established company.

In this Role, you’ll get to:
• Translate internal briefs into analytical projects (to include refining the initial brief and asking the ‘right questions’, working through potential hypotheses and storyboarding the output)
• Use and analyze data from multiple large-scale data warehouses and present statistically strong analysis to a wide range of business stakeholders
• Proactively identify opportunities for growth within supply and the wider business
• Drive new analytical initiatives and projects aimed at improving organizational efficiency and shaping Agoda supply
• Identify, support, and lead projects aimed at scaling up the way the Supply organization leverages on data, insights, and intelligence
• Automate manual operational processes and present back on time savings gained through modernization of business operations

What you’ll Need to Succeed:
• At least 3-5+ years of experience working as an Analyst with experience in analytics/data science/insights/strategy/BI
• Advanced working knowledge and hands-on experience in SQL
• Strong knowledge and hands-on experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau (preferably)
• Expert domain of data analysis and data visualization tools and software such as Excel, Python (or R)
• Bachelor’s degree ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
• A good understanding of statistical modelling knowledge or any machine learning technique knowledge (such as hypothesis testing, regression, logistic regression, random forest, etc.)
• Good stakeholder management experience. Comfortable presenting to senior leadership and C-suite
• Experience in conducting A/B testing experimentation
• Strong experience in finding data insights and provide business recommendation to the business
• A hacker’s mindset – the ability to build simple but clever and elegant solutions to new problems within significant resource, operational and time constraints through deep understanding of the business, creative problem solving, and a wide range of expertise in data, analytics, automation, programming, and prototyping
• Excellent communicator with superior written, verbal, presentation and interpersonal communication skills
• Data driven in both decision making and performance measurement
• Extreme comfort in ambiguous, fast-paced environment
• Ability to multi-task, prioritize and coordinate resources

It’s Great if you Have:
• MBA or Masters in a quantitative subject (e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics or finance)
• Program management certifications (e.g. PMI, PRINCE2) to compliment your program management experience
• Asian market experience
• Travel industry / e-commerce / tech / consulting experience

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Agoda, we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex, age, race, color, national origin, religion, marital status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, citizenship, veteran or military status, and other legally protected characteristics.

We will keep your application on file so that we can consider you for future vacancies and you can always ask to have your details removed from the file. For more details please read our privacy policy .

To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias, Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes

title: Consumer Insights Data Senior Analyst
description:
PricingOne is a consulting firm with a start-up mindset specialized in Revenue Growth Management and Pricing Strategies for Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG/FMCG) companies to “unlock growth where others can’t”. We deliver a unique consumer-centric approach to Revenue Growth Management (RGM), combining a proven cutting-edge methodology, powered by a highly experienced team. You will be joining a highly dynamic and growing company, working across more than 20 countries over 5 continents. Come learn and contribute to the development of PricingOne. For more information, please visit www.pricing.one.

Consumer Insights & Data Senior Analyst

MAIN PURPOSE

You will be a key member of our team of expert business partners, part of the Production department (Analytics/Insights/BI) located in Geneva. You will work closely with a team of experts and analysts on several projects and will report to the Production VP. You will help deliver expert business analysis and recommendations to... PricingOneclients. Your role will be to explore and analyze client data on sales performance, consumer behavior, trade and pricing response, design and supervise consumer and market research to guide business and pricing recommendations. You will leverage statistical and analytical tools available to you to also conduct scenario and simulations. You will be accountable for delivering on the assigned project tasks and milestones.

YOUR PROFILE

With a business, commercial, or marketing background, you are a specialist in analyzing and interpreting data and are able to articulate insights into actionable recommendations. You have an outstanding expertise in market research and a fundamental understanding of the clients' needs regarding marketing, pricing and portfolio growth. You are committed and always work with integrity. You are a team player and bring strong analytical and presentation skills plus creativity and enthusiasm to your work and to everything you do. Highly organized and efficient with the ability to work on their own initiative and meet multiple deadlines.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
• Defining quantitative methods to be used by agencies and “outside-the-box” thinking to help answer complex business questions.
• Manage all phases of a market research study except for programming & modeling: questionnaire design, fieldwork management (no actual coordination with fieldwork agencies), data analysis, preparation of reports and presentations in line with strategic business issues.
• Manage various data sources (e.g.: Trade panel, Consumer panel, P&L, Promotion calendars, etc.) to build the appropriate database
• Consulting clients on their business issues to help optimize marketing communication, product pricing and portfolios, and new product developments.
• Ensuring good and efficient collaboration with third-party agencies in different countries.
• Independent management of client contact during day-to-day project management.
• Ensuring that the assigned projects are optimally carried out and deadlines are met.
• Leverage several sources of data to analyze general as well as specific trends, year-over-year sales, key regional and product differences including relevant competitive information

KEY REQUIREMENTS
• Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Statistics or in a related field. A Master’s degree in business administration, market research, marketing life sciences, sociology or psychology will be advantageous.
• Minimum of >5-10 years of relevant work experience (Market Research, Business analysis in agencies or in B2C CPG/FMCG industry), ideally with good knowledge of the Swiss market.
• Strong Project Management skills are mandatory.
• Exposure to various quantitative/qualitative market research methodologies; knowledge of conjoint (Choice-Based Conjoint) analysis is a plus.
• Experience in analyzing pricing elasticities, promotion effectiveness, forecasting consumption, user flows, revenue and market shares using retail panel data (e.g.: Nielsen, IRI, etc).
• Interest in data management.
• Have developed Business Awareness in consulting clients on their challenges.
• Entrepreneurial and pro-active attitude.
• Eye for details.
• Strong analytical and communication skills
• Ability to perform independent research to solve problems.
• Ability to thrive while working on multiple projects.
• Ability to work well across teams but also independently.
• Strong knowledge of Excel (pivots), Word, and PowerPoint.
• SQL, Power BI and VBA/macros experience is a plus.
• Excellent written and oral communication skills in English
• French or German is a plus
• Keen interest in talking to clients of leading companies and consulting them on their business challenges.

WHY WORK FOR PRICINGONE
• Large variety of tasks and projects that will enhance both your soft and hard skills.
• Wonderful international & multi-cultural team to work with.
• Amazing development opportunity in excellent business environment with passionate experts.
• Networking opportunities across the industry, at senior leadership level.
• We offer real work assignments that come as ideal education complement.
• Flexible hours.

OUR APPLICATION PROCESS

Please send us at Write an email your resume, cover letter, certifications and work attestations (e.g., references, letters of recommendation and university certificates). If your application is selected, we will reach out to you asap for an Assessment test. Following which, should your assessment be successful, next step will be face-to-face and/or video call interviews

title: Data Analyst
description:
Tu as récemment obtenu ton diplôme et tu souhaites débuter ta carrière dans le secteur bancaire? Tu aimes ce qui est lié à la gestion de la donnée et tu as un intérêt pour la finance et les investissements? On dit de toi que tu es rigoureux et tu fais attention aux détails? N'attends plus c'est une opportunité à ne pas rater!

Localisation: Genève

Catégorie du poste: IT

Durée: Temps plein, mission d'une année

Date de début: Dès que possible

Type de travail: Mission

Tu intègreras une équipe en place, active dans la data et tu participeras à l'acquisition des données liées aux investissements alternatifs. C'est une chance d'intégrer un département dynamique et de développer tes connaissances.

Ce processus de recrutement est géré par Academic Work et notre client souhaite que toutes les questions concernant le poste soient adressées à Academic Work.

Notre processus de sélection est continu et l'annonce peut être clôturée avant la fin du processus de recrutement si nous sommes... passés à la phase suivante.

Lorsque vous postulez à cette offre, vous rejoignez les nombreux consultants d’Academic Work. Vous profiterez de nombreux bénéfices mais aurez aussi une équipe de Consultant Manager pour vous soutenir dans cette étape de votre carrière.En apprendre plus sur Academic Work

Nadina Marques ou un-e de nos collègues de l'équipe recrutement vous répondra par e-mail sur l'adresse Écrire un email Merci de préciser le numéro de l'offre dans votre e-mail: 15104570

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 15 jours

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 8 jours

Genève

Publiée il y a il y a 26 jours

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.

More information

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising

title: Data Analyst - Marketing (6-month contract)
description:
A career at Lombard Odier means working for a renowned global wealth and asset manager, with a strong focus on sustainable investing. An innovative bank of choice for private and institutional clients, our independently owned Firm is one of the best-capitalised banking groups in the world, managing close to CHF

300 billion and operating from over 25 offices across 4 continents.

With a history spanning over 225 years, Lombard Odier is an investment house providing a comprehensive offering of discretionary and advisory portfolio management, wealth services and custody. We also offer asset management services and investment strategies through Lombard Odier Investment Managers and provide

advanced banking technology to other financial institutions.

“Rethink Everything” is our philosophy – it is at the heart of everything we do. We have grown stronger through more than 40 financial crises by rethinking the world around us to provide a fresh investment perspective for our clients.

Data... Analyst - Marketing (6-months contract)

As part of the Marketing & Communication department, you will join the Digital Marketing team in charge of several platform and in particular our website www.lombardodier.com

YOUR MISSION
• Creation and modification of Looker Studio Dashboard
• Analyse website traffic and its sources
• Prepare regular reports for management using data from analytics platform.
• Response to ad hoc data requests

YOUR PROFILE
• Degree in computer science, information technology, or equivalent experience
• Knowledge of Business Intelligence Dashboarding tool (Looker Studio preferred) and Analytic platform (Google Analytics 4 preferred)
• Interest in Marketing Digital domain
• Strong analytical skills and rigor in data processing
• Team player with strong communication skills
• Quick learner with strong problem-solving skills
• Oral and written in French and English
• Resident in Switzerland

Our Maison’s DNA is defined by five core values. Excellence drives us to be the best at what we do, while Innovation fuels our progress. Respect underpins every interaction, and Integrity shapes our actions. Together, we are One Team, united in serving our clients with unwavering dedication.

Should you recognise yourself in this mission statement, we would be happy to receive your application. It will be handled in the strictest confidence

title: Power BI Data Analyst
description:
Role

As a Power BI Data Analyst specializing in data visualization, your mission is to leverage your expertise to transform complex datasets into meaningful and actionable insights to drive informed business decisions. You will be responsible for creating impactful visualizations by leveraging various data sources ingested into Snowflake, and utilizing Power BI to create visualizations.

What you will be responsible for

As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for:

Expertise in transforming complex datasets into meaningful and actionable insights. Proficiency in creating impactful visualizations using Power BI. Experience in leveraging various data sources within Snowflake for visualization purposes. Capability to gather requirements from diverse audiences for data visualization. Collaboration skills with both business and technical teams to enhance data-driven decision-making processes. Proficiency in automating reporting processes. Contributing to driving business growth and... improving operational efficiency through data insights.

Depending on your previous experiences and appetite to grow, you will play an active role in practice development.

Requirements

What we are looking for
3 years of experience as a Business Analyst / BI developer Power BI Data Analyst Certification is mandatory Proven track in transforming abstract questions into quantifiable metrics Experience in the luxury manufacturing industry SQL proficiency Experience with Snowflake Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and French.

Benefits

What we offer
A competitive compensation package A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us A position that enables you to have an impact on 1’000s of people, and the whole company's growth. An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset

title: Business Analyst - Master Data
description:
Votre équipe

La division Technology & Operations assure la conception et l’intégration d’une grande diversité de solutions informatiques allant des systèmes de gestion de portefeuille aux plateformes de trading en passant par les applications bancaires et les outils de gestion d’entreprise. A l’origine de quelques-unes des plus grandes innovations du Groupe, la division est également responsable du bon fonctionnement opérationnel ainsi que du développement des services de banque dépositaire et d’administration de fonds.

En qualité de Business Analyst au sein de la plateforme Data, domaine Master Data, de notre division Technology & Operations, vous effectuerez les tâches d’analyse fonctionnelle dans le cadre de projets relatifs à l’évolution et à la maintenance des applications numériques du groupe Pictet destinées à la clientèle privée et institutionnelle, ainsi qu’aux gérants indépendants.

Votre rôle
• Collecter et analyser les besoins exprimés par les lignes de métier concernées... dans le cadre de projets d'évolution et de maintenance.
• Concevoir et proposer des solutions informatiques pragmatiques, en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de développement et les architectes.
• Rédiger les spécifications fonctionnelles de manière itérative selon la méthodologie Agile, les faire valider par les sponsors et les communiquer aux équipes en charge de la réalisation (y compris intervenants hors de l’équipe principale).
• Définir les cas de tests fonctionnels permettant de valider les solutions proposées; mener les tests d'acceptance et de non-régression (FAT).
• Prendre en charge, documenter et analyser les incidents de production, ainsi que les demandes de support de 3e niveau.
• Assurer le piquet pour l'application centrale du domaine Master Data.

Votre profil
• Diplôme EPF, HES ou universitaire, ou titre jugé équivalent.
• Au moins trois ans d’expérience en tant que business analyst, acquise en relation avec un outil de Data Management (p. ex. Neoxam).
• Bonne compréhension des marchés financiers et des principaux produits financiers (actions, produits à revenu fixe, dérivés, devises).
• Excellente aptitude à organiser et à animer efficacement des séances et des workshops.
• Capacité à traiter de sujets complexes avec des interlocuteurs aux profils très variés.
• Excellent sens de l’organisation, bonne résistance au stress et aptitude à gérer les priorités ainsi qu’à résoudre les problèmes.
• Rigueur, autonomie et profond esprit d’équipe.
• Expérience dans l’utilisation des méthodologies Agile, idéalement Scrum.
• Très bonne maîtrise orale et écrite du français et de l’anglais: indispensable.
• Domicile en Suisse requis.

Doté/e d’un excellent esprit d’analyse et de conceptualisation, vous possédez des connaissances techniques approfondies et placez la satisfaction du client en tête de vos priorités. Vous serez à même de répondre aux besoins des lignes de métier en proposant des solutions pragmatiques et fiables. Vous saurez en outre estimer les charges de travail et respecter les échéances, et pourrez ainsi mener à bien les missions qui vous seront confiées.

Note

BA MD / RH / JA

Nous n'acceptons pas les dossiers transmis par agences.

Diversité & Inclusion

Pictet est un employeur qui respecte l’égalité des chances et favorise la diversité. Le respect des personnes et l’inclusion au travail sont au coeur de nos préoccupations

description:

Data Analyst logistique (H/F)
Domaine d’activité: Achat / Chaîne logistique Contrat: CDI Site: Genève Publiée: 25 mai 2024
Introduction

Pour notre service Support & Stratégie Logistique, nous recherchons un Data Analyst Logistique (H/F) dont la mission principale sera la collecte, l’exploitation et l’interprétation de données afin de dégager des orientations et optimisations logistiques.

Responsabilités
• Participer aux projets logistiques intégrant une expertise en analyse de données
• Comprendre les problématiques métier et... les traduire de manière analytique
• Cartographier des flux et identifier les données et points de mesure pertinents
• Extraire les données de systèmes sources (SAP, MES, LES, Equipements)
• Travailler les données collectées pour les rendre exploitables et maitriser leur qualité
• Mener des analyses de données, utiliser des modèles de simulation, afin de dégager des orientations ou optimisations logistiques
• Créer des tableaux de bord et des indicateurs de mesure
• Communiquer les résultats de manière accessible avec des outils de data visualisation
• Effectuer de la veille sur les outils d’analyse et de simulation

Profil
• Ingénieur HES, EPF ou équivalent en logistique
• Connaissance des outils d’analyse de données (Python, R, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données (SQL)
• Simulation de flux logistique un plus
• Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie
• Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace
• Dynamisme, flexibilité et esprit d'équipe

log23

Conclusion

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).
• Accueil
• Nos offres

Partager

Les montres Rolex sont symboles d’excellence, de performance et de prestige. Rolex est à l’origine de nombreuses innovations horlogères majeures, dont l’Oyster, première montre-bracelet étanche, née en 1926, et le remontage automatique par rotor Perpetual, inventé en 1931. Depuis sa fondation, Rolex a déposé plus de 500 brevets.

title: Business Analyst Power
description:
Responsibilities
• Collection of business requirements through various workshops and sessions.
• Writing functional and technical specifications.
• Supporting and coordinating necessary resources for delivery.
• Testing and monitoring developments (technical) and features with business teams.
• Implementation of surprise reports and impact analysis.
• Participating in the implementation of new solutions and enhancing existing ones.

Essential skills
• 5-10 years of work experience in a public services or commodities trading environment, with knowledge of electricity markets.
• Knowledge of optimization/machine learning models, market fundamentals, market/quantitative analysis, and physical trading.
• Experience in project management, DevOps, requirements engineering, and Agile delivery methodologies.
• Ability to manage multiple activities simultaneously, good communication and organizational skills, attention to detail, and teamwork spirit.
• Fluency in English and French in a... professional setting.

Only applications from Swiss and EU citizens will be considered / Our positions are accessible to people with disabilities

title: Energy Data Portfolio Analyst
description:
Pays

Suisse

Lieu

Switzerland

Lieu de travail

GENEVE-WTC1(CHE)

Société employeur

TotalEnergies Gas & Power Ltd

Domaine

Systèmes d'Information

Type de contrat

CDI

Expérience

Moins de 3 ans

Profil du candidat
• You hold a master’s degree in engineering / finance or an equivalent.
• You have 2-3 years’ experience in the Gas and Power markets with a high data analysis component.
• Strong operational and modelling skills with the ability to implement those using commonly used tools – Alteryx, Python and PBI.
• Strong analytical capabilities, especially in energy markets and in a broader economical field.
• A team player who works well with internal team(s), partners and external stakeholders.
• Forward-looking individual with the ability to work autonomously while being well organised.
• Fluent in English and secondary language is essential – French, Spanish and Italian.

At TotalEnergies, we believe that our employees’ fulfilment has its roots in the wealth of the experiences... they are offered. We are an equal opportunity employer committed to respecting diversity and inclusion in the workplace.

Applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard for race, color, gender, religion, national origin, disability, military status, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender.

Activités

Job Dimension:

Energy Data Management team consists of 8 FTE based in Geneva and is managing all detailed data supplied by 45 market system operators and providers, within 10 markets on power and gas, in a centralised database portal to calculate imbalances and costs associated with physical trades on behalf of the 40 market access affiliated contracts of TotalEnergies.

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst with the Deputy Head of Energy Data Management on the team is responsible for the reconciliation, P&L explanation and invoice-able amount of nearly 1.8 billion Euros from these group affiliated contracts a year with growth expected. The team supports the development of the business across further markets and less-carbonised commodities by developing an Energy Data Hub.

The team is the direct liaison to the market system operators to on-board assets onto TotalEnergies balancing perimeters, is responsible for continuous data collection from different sources, data comparison, check, cleaning, and enables a seamless and flexible single access to accurate and robust data in which it is then shared with our internal and external stakeholders. The Energy Data Management team is accountable for collaborating with relevant departments on ensuring accuracy of data while implementing into the trading system and reviewing robustness of all internal systems as it relates to this data.

What you will do:

The Energy Data Portfolio Analyst as part of the Trading Support department is responsible to ensure reconciliations with group affiliates.

Energy Data Portfolio Analyst will work with Trading Systems team to ensure systems can manage contracts that fits the needs of all departments such as Front Office, Middle Office, Back Office and Finance departments. Contracts can include but not limited to Power Purchase Agreements, Procurement of Gas and Power for industrial sites of the affiliates, Energy Mechanisms, and Gas Sales Agreements

Thus, your main tasks will be the following:
• Ensuring allocation data is received in a timely manner and communicating to TSO/DSO on allocation issues while verifying data accuracy daily and proper reflection in trading system.
• Reconciling group affiliated contracts and booking of actualization of contract into trading system ahead of settlements.
• Report and explain any P&L impact to Middle Office.
• Produce key performance measures around imbalances of assets and TGP short-term activities that will be used for back testing of commercial contracts pricing.
• Producing reports for internal and external stakeholders for purposes such as regulatory reporting, customs and contract reviews.
• Updating procedures to ensure clarity and feasibility of process reference.
• Communicating to Trading Systems team new requirements to book contracts into system.
• Assisting Back Office with contract changes or revisions that can generate accruals.

Contexte et environnement

Fast-paced trading environment requires the jobholder to be able to work both autonomously and a team to produce quick results. Global trading environment involves communication to be sent and received in several languages.

The role operates within a changing energy market mainly due to environmental and regulatory impacts and requirements.

In house systems requires deep collaboration with other departments and IT teams to implement.

Our Culture:

We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population and we are committed to the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation. We are fully embracing the digital revolution.

Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success.

Reinforcing the competencies of our people is a key pillar of our culture: we train our people to ensure their development and we pledge to encourage safety in all our actions.

We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding industry that requests to be always on the edge, we cultivate a friendly workplace where our people feel good, where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.

TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply & demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050

title: Data Analyst
description:
Job opportunity for a Data Analyst

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our teams.

Your responsibilities:
• Gather, analyze, and interpret data from various internal and external sources.
• Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
• Collaborate with key departments (production, logistics, finance, etc.) to understand their data needs and provide relevant analyses.
• Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for continuous improvement within company processes.
• Design and implement data models to predict future performance and support decision-making.
• Ensure quality, consistency, and integrity of data used for analysis.
• Provide data-driven recommendations to optimize company processes and strategies.
• Utilize data visualization tools and techniques to effectively communicate analysis results.

Your profile:
• Degree in statistics, computer science, data analysis, or equivalent.
• Minimum 2 years of experience in a similar... role.
• Strong skills in data analysis and problem-solving.
• Experience with data analysis and visualization tools (Excel, SQL, Tableau, Power BI, etc.).
• Excellent ability to interpret and present complex data in a clear and concise manner.
• Good communication and teamwork skills.
• Proficiency in programming languages for data analysis (Python, R) is a plus.
• Knowledge of data management principles and best practices for data quality.

Our company culture:

• Agility: Thrive in a flexible, dynamic, and stimulating environment.

• International: Benefit from international collaborations and numerous mobility opportunities.

• Intrapreneurship: Get involved in parallel initiatives or develop your own Business Unit.

• Listening Management: Receive personalized support throughout your professional journey.

Amaris Consulting is committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of gender, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, beliefs, age, marital status, disability, or any other characteristic

Chargé de projets Data Analyst (H/F)
Domaine d’activité: Autres domaines Contrat: CDI Site: Genève Publiée: 4 juin 2024
Introduction

Pour notre division Achats, Soutien & Infrastructures, nous recherchons un Chargé de projetsData Analyst (H/F) dont la mission principale sera de contribuer à la maturité de la division dans l’exploitation et l’interprétation des données.

Responsabilités
• Contribuer au support et à l’animation du réseau de compétences Data au sein de la division
• Recenser, analyser, prioriser et répondre aux... besoins de données exprimés par les clients internes en collaboration avec la division informatique
• Contribuer, prioriser et coordonner la collecte des données sources de la division
• Développer et concevoir des tableaux de bord sur l’outil Tableau pour répondre aux besoins transverses
• Soutenir l’analyse des solutions utilisées et en assurer la qualité
• Soutenir et former les utilisateurs aux bonnes pratiques sur la gestion et l’utilisation des outils et des données
• Contribuer à la veille sur les évolutions techniques en partenariat avec la division informatique

Profil
• Formation universitaire d’ingénieur généraliste (EPF), informatique, en management ou formation jugée équivalente
• Minimum 5 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire
• Solides connaissances des modèles de données de production et de logistique
• Expérience confirmée en analyse métier
• Maîtrise des outils de Business Intelligence (Tableau, Excel VBA, PowerQuery) et des outils bureautiques
• Aisance relationnelle, aptitude à travailler en équipe
• Excellentes capacités à communiquer et à fédérer
• Personne autonome, flexible, rigoureuse et organisée
• Fort esprit analytique, approche systémique et esprit de synthèse

Conclusion

Nous vous offrons un environnement stimulant, d’excellentes conditions de travail, des solutions de flexibilisation du temps de travail et des prestations sociales de premier ordre.

Nous vous remercions d'adresser un dossier de candidature complet (CV, lettre de motivation, certificats et diplômes).

#LI-Hybrid
• Accueil
• Nos offres

Partager

Les montres Rolex sont symboles d’excellence, de performance et de prestige. Rolex est à l’origine de nombreuses innovations horlogères majeures, dont l’Oyster, première montre-bracelet étanche, née en 1926, et le remontage automatique par rotor Perpetual, inventé en 1931. Depuis sa fondation, Rolex a déposé plus de 500 brevets.

Types of jobs Crédit Agricole SA - Sales / Customer Relations
Job title

VIE - DATA ANALYST H/F
Type of Contract

VIE
Duration (in months)

12 months
Expected start date

01/06/2024
Missions

Within the Business Development & Business Control Department of our Wealth Management Division, you will be in charge of the following missions:
• Analyze customer data (qualitative & quantitative) in the commercial approach;
• Contribute to product and credit segmentation;
• Participate in the identification of the market / commercial area for highlights (products);
• Automate processes to optimize controls, statistical data (LSFin, KYC Reviews, etc.) as well as reports and supports for the Front-Office.

Experience

Skills sought

IT tools
• Mastery of MS Office and in particular VBA, Python (excel)
• SharePoint - Programming and development

LANGUAGES

Fluency in French and English

Selon vos intérêts et attentes ainsi qu’en fonction de vos expériences, nous trouvons l’emploi idéal pour vous. Inscrivez-vous et profitez de postes et projets intéressants et adéquats. Nous nous réjouissons de faire votre connaissance"]}]

title: Data Analyst, Allocation
description:
Data Analyst, Allocation - GL C - Temporary until December 2025The Global Fund's allocation model determines the funding amounts available to eligible countries for each replenishment cycle to fight HIV, TB and malaria. Every three years, the allocation methodology is reviewed to evolve with changing epidemiological and economic contexts and to reflect new data and other information. Work is underway to update the methodology for the cycle.

The Global Fund is seeking a Data Analyst to join the Allocation Team for the allocation methodology review and implementation to produce final allocations. The Data Analyst would work closely with other team members to prepare high-quality quantitative analysis related to the Global Fund's allocation model, validate scenario runs of the allocation formula and conduct data quality controls. This role requires using advanced analytical and programming skills.

Key Responsibilities

The key tasks of the Data Analyst will be to:
• Conduct internal... validation of the R-code for the allocation formula.
• Conduct quality control of the inputs and outputs of the allocation formula scenarios run by the Specialist, Allocation Team.
• Provide high-quality and timely quantitative analysis on aspects of the allocation methodology.
• Working closely with team members and collaborating with other teams, compile and review programmatic, financial and other relevant grant and country data – and support management of this information on dashboards – for the qualitative adjustments process to finalize the allocations.
• Conduct, as needed, data quality controls on other allocation-related analyses to ensure outputs are accurate and of high quality.
• Support the Allocation Team in implementing the allocation model to produce, verify and communicate final allocation funding amounts.
• Demonstrate a high level of confidentiality and integrity in processing important data

Subject to change by the Executive Director at any time at their sole discretion.

Qualifications

Essential:
• Bachelor's degree in data science, economics or other quantitative discipline

Experience

Essential:
• At least two years of experience in international development or global health
• Excellent quantitative and analytical skills; at least three years' experience producing analysis from complex datasets; experience in modelling.
• Sound judgment with ability to apply strategic thinking and high-quality advice based on complex analysis
• Excellent skills in Excel and PowerPoint
• Programming experience in R

Desirable:
• Experience in other programming languages (in particular Python and SQL)

Competencies

Languages:

An excellent knowledge of English and preferably a good working knowledge of French. Knowledge of other languages would be an asset.

Functional Competencies:
• Project Management: Mastery
• Analytical: Mastery
• Communications: Mastery

The Global Fund recruits top-tier talent for our open positions, in support of our mission to end AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria as epidemics.

Explore our vacancies and apply on the Global Fund Careers recruitment system.

More information on working at the Global Fund is available on the Careers section of our main website.

Job Posting End Date
12 May 2024

title: Intern, Statistical Analyst
HR Business and Data Analyst
description:
HR Data and Technology Unit, Human Resources Operations Service, Human Resources Management Department, Sector of the Director General
Grade - P3
Contract Duration - 2 years (maximum cumulative length of 5 years) *
Duty Station : CH-Geneva
Publication Date : 22-Apr-2024 Application Deadline : 17-May-2024, 4:59:00 PM

IMPORTANT NOTICE REGARDING APPLICATION DEADLINE: please note that the deadline for applications is indicated in local time as per the time zone of the applicant's location.

This post is a limited-term fixed-term post.

1.Organizational Context

a. Organizational Setting
The position is located in the HR Data and Technology Unit of the Human Resources Operations Service, Human Resources Management Department. The HR Data and Technology Unit leads the digital transformation efforts of HRMD by leveraging the power of data and technology to deliver people-centric solutions that enable informed decisions, effective business processes that meet the HR-related needs of... business, and facilitates the coordination, implementation and maintenance of HR-related data and IT-solutions.

b. Purpose Statement
The Business Analyst is expected to develop effective reporting tools for HR data and analytics on talent management, to support redesigning and digitalization of HR-related business processes and to lead and coordinate the development of HR-related data and IT solutions, in close cooperation with the business owners and WIPO's IT system delivery teams.

c. Reporting Lines
The Business Analyst reports to the Manager, HR Data and Technology Unit.

d. Work Relations
S/he works closely with colleagues from the Talent Management Service and HR Operations as well as other stakeholders across the Organization, especially with WIPO's IT system delivery teams.

2.Duties and Responsibilities

The incumbent will perform the following principal duties:
a. Contribute to the development of a strategic vision and roadmap for people analytics to provide HRMD and business leaders with greater access and visibility to human capital data and analytics.
b. Build awareness of analytics solutions and best practices to foster the creation of a data-driven culture, related competencies and data literacy across HRMD.
c. Identify needs in relation to data collections, analyze talent management data, develop models, identify trends, generate insights and apply story-telling approaches, that contribute to the organizations capacity to make data-driven decisions on HR-related matters.
d. Design, prototype, test and implement effective reporting and data-visualization tools in close cooperation with WIPO's IT system delivery teams, that provide HRMD, WIPO business leaders and external stakeholders with the necessary insights on human capital data and analytics.
e. Coordinate the development, production, automation, maintenance and delivery of regular people metrics and reports, to monitor KPIs and dashboards to help influence and drive strategy and take informed decisions.
f. Analyze and document current HR-related business processes, IT solutions and user journeys, propose improvements and optimizations for streamlining those and identify indicators to measure benefits.
g. Propose and implement suitable tools and techniques including further automation of employee and manager self-service processes to enhance employee experience.
h. Identify and analyze evolving business needs, gather and document user requirements for HR-related IT tools, work in close cooperation with WIPO's IT system delivery teams on drafting related technical specifications, prototyping, user testing and implementation of necessary changes to HR-related IT solutions to ensure that tools are built and enhanced according to business needs.
i. Perform other duties as required.

3.Requirements

Education (Essential)
First-level university degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics, Mathematics or related field. Any other first-level university degree complemented by relevant experience may be considered.

Experience (Essential)
At least six years of relevant professional work experience, of which at least two years in working with HR data, in the business intelligence and/or people analytics fields.
Experience in analyzing a wide range of HR metrics and/or talent data, developing data models, identifying trends and generating insights.
Experience in analyzing and improving HR-IT systems and processes, in particular, in supporting an HR function in its digital transformation.
Experience in developing dashboards using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.

Experience (Desirable)
Experience with agile project methodologies.
Experience in using tools to document Use Case Diagrams, Data and Process Flow Diagrams etc.

Language (Essential)
Excellent knowledge of written and spoken English.

Language (Desirable)
Knowledge of other UN official languages, particularly French.

Job Related Competencies (Essential)
Solid HR domain knowledge and excellent understanding of challenges and opportunities related to application of people analytics.
Ability to analyze a wide range of HR data, to develop data models, identify trends, generate insights, and apply story-telling approaches.
Critical thinking to balance complex situations and think with a combination of set-in-stone processes and outside-the-box thinking.
Strong interpersonal, communication and collaboration skills. Ability to maintain effective partnerships and working relations in a multi-cultural environment with sensitivity and respect for diversity.
Demonstrated ability to handle confidential and sensitive information in an appropriate manner.

Job Related Competencies (Desirable)
Knowledge of data science languages such as R, Python, SPARK, MATLAB etc..

4.Organizational Competencies

1. Communicating effectively.
2. Showing team spirit.
3. Demonstrating integrity.
4. Valuing diversity.
5. Producing results.
6. Showing service orientation.
7. Seeing the big picture.
8. Seeking change and innovation.
9. Developing yourself and others.

5.Information

Mobility: WIPO staff members are international civil servants subject to the authority of the Director General and may be assigned to any activities, office or duty station of the Organization. Accordingly, the selected candidate may be required to move from time to time to new functions and/or to another duty station.

Annual salary:

Total annual salary consists of a net annual salary (net of taxes and before medical insurance and pension fund deductions) in US dollars and a post adjustment. Please note that this estimate is for information only. The post adjustment multiplier (cost of living allowance) is variable and subject to change (increase or decrease) without notice. The figures quoted below are based on the April 2024 rate of 84.8%

P3

Annual salary

$62,692

Post adjustment

$53,163

Total Salary

$115,855

Currency USD

Salaries and allowances are paid in Swiss francs at the official rate of exchange of the United Nations.

Please refer to WIPO's Staff Regulation and Rules for detailed information concerning salaries, benefits and allowances.

Additional Information
• Initial fixed-term appointment of two years, renewable subject to satisfactory performance and other applicable conditions. The selected candidate's appointment will be subject to an overall term of five years in this position, with no possibility of renewal beyond that term. S/he may, however, apply and be considered for other positions at WIPO.

This is not applicable to WIPO staff members on fixed-term, continuing or permanent appointments, who were recruited following a competition under Staff Regulation 4.10 ("Appointment Boards").
This vacancy announcement may be used to fill other posts at the same grade with similar functions in accordance with Staff Rule 4.9.5.
The Organization reserves the right to make an appointment at a grade lower than that advertised.

By completing an application, candidates understand that any willful misrepresentation made on this web site, or on any other documents submitted to WIPO during the application, may result in disqualification from the recruitment process, or termination of employment with WIPO at a later date, if that employment resulted from such willful misrepresentations.

In the event that your candidature is shortlisted, you will be required to provide, in advance, a scanned copy of an identification and of the degree(s)/diploma(s)/certificate(s) required for this position. WIPO only considers higher educational qualifications obtained from an institution accredited/recognized in the World Higher Education Database (WHED), a list updated by the International Association of Universities (IAU) / United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO). The list can be accessed through the link: Some professional certificates may not appear in the WHED and these will be reviewed individually.
Additional testing/interviewing may be used as a form of screening. Initial appointment is subject to satisfactory professional references.

Additional background checks may be required

title: Data Scientist
description:
Nous recherchons un(e) consultant(e) Data Scientist passionn(e) par la transformation des donnes complexes en solutions stratgiques pour nos clients.

Votre rle

En tant que Data Scientist vous jouerez un rle essentiel au sein de notre quipe DataAI & Analytics . Votre mission consistera dvelopper des modles dintelligence artificielle en utilisant diverses techniques notamment le Deep Learning la Computer Vision le Traitement du Langage Naturel le Reinforcement Learning et dautres mthodes avances dapprentissage automatique en fonction des besoins spcifiques de chaque projet.

Principales activits
• Collecte nettoyage et analyse des donnesprovenant de diverses sources.
• Exploration des donnes pour en comprendre la structure les tendances laidedes outils statistiques et des visualisations de donnes.
• Application des techniques statistiques et de machine learning pour dvelopper des modles prdictifs.
• Maintenance et amlioration des modles pour une performance optimale.
• Collaboration... avec les quipes techniques pour intgrer les solutions analytiques dveloppes.
• Prsenter et partager les rsultats

Diplmes et expriences professionnelles
• Diplme (Bachelor ou quivalent) en statistiques mathmatiques informatique ou domaine similaire
• Au moins 5 annes dexprience professionnelle

Qualifications
• Exprience prouve dans la ralisation et le dploiement des algorithmes et des modles de data science et dIA.
• Trs bonnes connaissances en Python et de Jupyter
• Maitrise desbibliothques telles que PyTorch TensorFlow Conda et Scikitlearn
• Trs bonnes connaissances du traitement du langage naturel
• Trs bonnes connaissances du Machine Learning et du Deep Learning
• Trs bonnes connaissances de la qualit des donnes
• Capacit travailler en quipe et partager ses connaissances
• Forte orientation solutions et rsultats
• Aisance relationnelle et orientation client
• Franais courant

Contrat : CDI

Taux dactivit : 100

title: Power BI Data Analyst
description:
Title: Power BI Data Analyst

Type: fixed-contract (9 months)

Location: Geneva, Meyrin

Start date: May 2024

About us

At Visium, we enable enterprise executives in defining their AI & Data strategy, execute large scale transformations and implement AI across operations, ensuring their organization becomes future-proof.

With expertise in strategy, architecture, cloud engineering, analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning, we empower our clients to unleash and scale the power of their data.

We're on a mission to pioneer a bright future and build future-proof and ethical organizations . Join the curious, the ambitious, the doers, the good-hearted, the ones who build a world we're all in awe of – our Visumees.

Ready to become one?

Role

As a Power BI Data Analyst specializing in data visualization, your mission is to leverage your expertise to transform complex datasets into meaningful and actionable insights to drive informed business decisions. You will be... responsible for creating impactful visualizations by leveraging various data sources ingested into Snowflake, and utilizing Power BI to create visualizations.

What you will be responsible for

As a Business Analyst you will be responsible for:
• Expertise in transforming complex datasets into meaningful and actionable insights.
• Proficiency in creating impactful visualizations using Power BI.
• Experience in leveraging various data sources within Snowflake for visualization purposes.
• Capability to gather requirements from diverse audiences for data visualization.
• Collaboration skills with both business and technical teams to enhance data-driven decision-making processes.
• Proficiency in automating reporting processes.
• Contributing to driving business growth and improving operational efficiency through data insights.

Depending on your previous experiences and appetite to grow, you will play an active role in practice development.

Requirements

What we are looking for
• 3 years of experience as a Business Analyst / BI developer
• Power BI Data Analyst Certification is mandatory
• Proven track in transforming abstract questions into quantifiable metrics
• Experience in the luxury manufacturing industry
• SQL proficiency
• Experience with Snowflake
• Ability to communicate complex ideas effectively – both verbally and in writing – in English and French.

Benefits

What we offer
• A competitive compensation package
• A yearly education budget to steep your learning curve
• A yearly sport budget because a fit body leads to a fit mind
• A flexible working culture because your work-life balance matters to us
• A position that enables you to have an impact on 1'000s of people, and the whole company's growth.
• An international, knowledgeable, and passionate team with a strong collaborative mindset

Check our LinkedIn and website to learn more about us & don't hesitate to contact us if you have any questions

title: Client Data Analyst
description:
Data Analyst Position:
• Responsible for collecting, processing, and analyzing client data to support key business decisions.
• Developing and maintaining reports and dashboards utilizing advanced Excel features.
• Collaborating closely with internal teams to identify and meet data analysis requirements.
• Ensuring data accuracy and integrity through meticulous validation and cross-verification.
• Presenting analytical insights to stakeholders in a coherent and understandable manner.
• Contributing to the design and execution of data management processes.

Requirements:
• 0-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related domain.
• Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, functions, and macros.
• Fluency in both French and English is essential.
• Strong grasp of financial principles and terminology.
• Preferably holding a Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Statistics, or a related discipline.
• Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving... capabilities.
• Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and collaboratively within a team.
• Eligibility to work legally in Switzerland

title: Web Analyst
description:
As a Web Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in analyzing website data to provide actionable insights and recommendations. You'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives, define key performance indicators (KPIs), and measure the impact of digital initiatives. Your work will directly contribute to improving user experiences, and driving business growth.

Help us in building, designing, maintaining, and improving this system. Together let’s create a collaborative workspace, develop fresh and effective practices, and boost the European job ads market!

Find out more about our unique culture and why you should work at JobCloud.

Your Tasks
• Implement Adobe Analytics, be the driving force of the company-wide tracking
• Develop clear and concise dashboards to creatively visualize KPIs and performance metrics (Adobe analytics, Tableau)
• Be the owner of a new marketing attribution model, measure the impact of marketing efforts and making them more... tangible, ROAS, ROI of brand activities
• Engage in proactive dialogue with business partners, to understand and impact their roadmaps and priorities effectively
• Conduct quantitative analyses, both recurring and ad-hoc, to provide data-driven insights for day-to-day decision making
• Lead the implementation of the Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM)
• Close cooperation with the Data Engineering team to ensure a solid data collection (CDP) into the internal DWH (Single Source of Truth)

Your skills
• Bachelor's degree in business with a quantitative focus, computer science, or equivalent
• Minimum of 5 years' experience in a similar role, preferably in a digital environment
• Curious individual with a passion for web analytics, data mining and a keen interest in data visualization
• Ability to work independently in a cross-functional environment
• Proven skills in Adobe Analytics, Data Warehouse (DWH) and Business Intelligence (BI), preferably using SQL and Tableau
• Proficient in SQL and Excel; familiarity with Python or R is a plus
• Fluency in English is mandatory; proficiency in German and French is an asset

Our offer
• The chance to shape the recruitment market in Switzerland
• Great opportunity to work with international and cross-functional teams
• JobCloud provides the latest generation equipment (hardware & software) to work efficiently
• A hybrid working model with flexible working hours and the possibility to work remotely
• Considering the experience we are looking for this position, a reasonable salary range for a 100% position is between CHF 110'000 and 120'000.

Benefits
• Maternity /paternity/adoption leave:

Moms: 16 weeks. Dads/adoption: 3 weeks. Fully paid.
• Mobile Office:

Work from the office, from home, or both
• Language classes:

For free! Generally English, German and French classes, but others are also available
• Workation:

Work from abroad up to 10 days per year!
• Further training:

Is supported - in the sense of #lifelong-learning!
• Pension scheme:

Occupational pension: we cover 60% of the contributions
• Lunch:

Our FELFEL fridge is always full of tasty dishes for a fair price - Home Delivery also possible!
• Public transport discounts:

Up to 650.- for public transport and a Half-Fare Card for free!

Your Contact Person

Marina
Senior Talent Acquisition Partner

Phone: +41 79 349 32 51

title: Sustainability analyst
description:
About Our Client

International company based in Geneva

Job Description
• Assisting in the execution of our corporate sustainability strategy, encompassing our energy transition, climate change adaptation, and environmental initiatives.
• Conducting the data reporting procedure for CSRD implementation, involving data gathering, validation, analysis, and generating reports for both internal and external stakeholders.
• Overseeing the carbon accounting process to precisely quantify, monitor, and disclose greenhouse gas emissions, while also aiding in the formulation of a reporting framework for Scope 3 emissions.
• Examining data patterns and crafting insightful visual representations to empower management in making well-informed decisions.

The Successful Applicant
• Completion of a university degree in science, engineering, economics, or a related field emphasizing quantitative skills.
• A minimum of 3 years' experience in a sustainability role focused on environmental or... energy-related matters, with a proven track record in reporting, impact assessment, and carbon accounting within either a consultancy or corporate environment.
• Comprehensive understanding of climate change, energy, and environmental subjects, along with demonstrated expertise in carbon accounting aligned with established standards such as the GHG Protocol.
• Familiarity with non-financial reporting frameworks like GRI, SASB, TCFD, CDP, as well as industry trends including forthcoming regulatory requirements such as EU CSRD/ESRS, CSDDD.
• Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools, including Excel and Power BI, coupled with adeptness in utilizing data reporting systems.
• Quick learner and ability to navigate evolving requirements and understand new concepts outside own expertise.
• Proficient in project management, handling competing priorities and overseeing simultaneous projects (planning, coordinating, reviewing progress and tracking results).
• Collaborative team player, adept at cross-functional collaboration across a range of diverse backgrounds and cultures.
• Good communication skills, fluency in English (oral and written).

What's on Offer

Permanent contract

title: Consultant_Data Analyst logistique
description:
Mission
s :
• Contribuer aux projets logistiques à travers l'expertise analyse de données,
• Comprendre les problématiques métier et les traduire de manière analytique,
• Cartographier des flux et identifier les données et points de mesures pertinents,
• Extraire les données de systèmes sources (ERP, MES, LES et Equipements),
• Mener des analyses de données, utiliser des modèles de simulation, afin de dégager des orientations ou optimisations logistiques,
• Créer des tableaux de bord et des indicateurs de mesure,
• Communiquer les résultats de manière accessible avec des outils de data visualisation,
• Faire de la veille sur les outils d'analyse et de simulation.

Profil :
• Ingénieur HES, EPF,
• Connaissance des outils d'analyse de données (Python, R, Tableau PREP, KNIME ou équivalent), de visualisation (TABLEAU) et base de données (SQL),
• Fortes compétences organisationnelles et autonomie,
• Aisance relationnelle, écoute, capacité de synthèse et communication efficace,
• Dynamisme... flexibilité et esprit d'équipe
